Where the reach depth exceeds 20 inches (510 mm), the high forward reach shall be 44 inches (1120 mm) maximum and the reach depth shall be 25 inches (635 mm) maximum.

title: Unobstructed
body: Where a clear floor or ground space allows a parallel approach to an element and the side reach is unobstructed, the high side reach shall be 48 inches (1220 mm) maximum and the low side reach shall be 15 inches (380 mm) minimum above the finish floor or ground.

title: Obstructed High Reach
body: Where a clear floor or ground space allows a parallel approach to an element and the high side reach is over an obstruction, the height of the obstruction shall be 34 inches (865 mm) maximum and the depth of the obstruction shall be 24 inches (610 mm) maximum. The high side reach shall be 48 inches (1220 mm) maximum for a reach depth of 10 inches (255 mm) maximum. Where the reach depth exceeds 10 inches (255 mm), the high side reach shall be 46 inches (1170 mm) maximum for a reach depth of 24 inches (610 mm) maximum.

title: General
body: Operable parts shall comply with 309.

title: Clear Floor Space
body: A clear floor or ground space complying with 305 shall be provided.

title: Height
body: Operable parts shall be placed within one or more of the reach ranges specified in 308.

title: Operation
body: Operable parts shall be operable with one hand and shall not require tight grasping, pinching, or twisting of the wrist. The force required to activate operable parts shall be 5 pounds (22.2 N) maximum.

title: Scope
body: The provisions of Chapter 4 shall apply where required by Chapter 2 or where referenced by a requirement in this document.

title: General
body: Accessible routes shall comply with 402.

title: Components
body: Accessible routes shall consist of one or more of the following components: walking surfaces with a running slope not steeper than 1:20, doorways, ramps, curb ramps excluding the flared sides, elevators, and platform lifts. All components of an accessible route shall comply with the applicable requirements of Chapter 4.

title: General
body: Walking surfaces that are a part of an accessible route shall comply with 403.

title: Floor or Ground Surface
body: Floor or ground surfaces shall comply with 302.

title: Slope
body: The running slope of walking surfaces shall not be steeper than 1:20. The cross slope of walking surfaces shall not be steeper than 1:48.

title: Changes in Level
body: Changes in level shall comply with 303.

title: Clearances
body: Walking surfaces shall provide clearances complying with 403.5.

title: Clear Width
body: Except as provided in 403.5.2 and 403.5.3, the clear width of walking surfaces shall be 36 inches (915 mm) minimum.

title: Clear Width at Turn
body: Where the accessible route makes a 180 degree turn around an element which is less than 48 inches (1220 mm) wide, clear width shall be 42 inches (1065 mm) minimum approaching the turn, 48 inches (1220 mm) minimum at the turn and 42 inches (1065 mm) minimum leaving the turn.

title: Passing Spaces
body: An accessible route with a clear width less than 60 inches (1525 mm) shall provide passing spaces at intervals of 200 feet (61 m) maximum. Passing spaces shall be either: a space 60 inches (1525 mm) minimum by 60 inches (1525 mm) minimum; or, an intersection of two walking surfaces providing a T-shaped space complying with 304.3.2 where the base and arms of the T-shaped space extend 48 inches (1220 mm) minimum beyond the intersection.

title: Handrails
body: Where handrails are provided along walking surfaces with running slopes not steeper than 1:20 they shall comply with 505.

title: General
body: Doors, doorways, and gates that are part of an accessible route shall comply with 404.

title: Manual Doors, Doorways, and Manual Gates
body: Manual doors and doorways and manual gates intended for user passage shall comply with 404.2.

title: Revolving Doors, Gates, and Turnstiles
body: Revolving doors, revolving gates, and turnstiles shall not be part of an accessible route.

title: Double-Leaf Doors and Gates
body: At least one of the active leaves of doorways with two leaves shall comply with 404.2.3 and 404.2.4.

title: Clear Width
body: Door openings shall provide a clear width of 32 inches (815 mm) minimum. Clear openings of doorways with swinging doors shall be measured between the face of the door and the stop, with the door open 90 degrees. Openings more than 24 inches (610 mm) deep shall provide a clear opening of 36 inches (915 mm) minimum. There shall be no projections into the required clear opening width lower than 34 inches (865 mm) above the finish floor or ground. Projections into the clear opening width between 34 inches (865 mm) and 80 inches (2030 mm) above the finish floor or ground shall not exceed 4 inches (100 mm).

title: Maneuvering Clearances
body: Minimum manuevering clearances at doors and gates shall comply with 404.2.4. Maneuvering clearances shall extend the full width of the doorway and the required latch side or hinge side clearance.

title: Swinging Doors and Gates
body: Swinging doors and gates shall have maneuvering clearances complying with Table 404.2.4.1.

title: Doorways without Doors or Gates, Sliding Doors, and Folding Doors
body: Doorways less than 36 inches (915 mm) wide without doors or gates, sliding doors, or folding doors shall have maneuvering clearances complying with Table 404.2.4.2.

title: Recessed Doors and Gates
body: Maneuvering clearances for forward approach shall be provided when any obstruction within 18 inches (455 mm) of the latch side of a doorway projects more than 8 inches (205 mm) beyond the face of the door, measured perpendicular to the face of the door or gate.

title: Floor or Ground Surface
body: Floor or ground surface within required maneuvering clearances shall comply with 302. Changes in level are not permitted.

title: Thresholds
body: Thresholds, if provided at doorways, shall be 1/2 inch (13 mm) high maximum. Raised thresholds and changes in level at doorways shall comply with 302 and 303.

title: Doors in Series and Gates in Series
body: The distance between two hinged or pivoted doors in series and gates in series shall be 48 inches (1220 mm) minimum plus the width of doors or gates swinging into the space.

title: Door and Gate Hardware
body: Handles, pulls, latches, locks, and other operable parts on doors and gates shall comply with 309.4. Operable parts of such hardware shall be 34 inches (865 mm) minimum and 48 inches (1220 mm) maximum above the finish floor or ground. Where sliding doors are in the fully open position, operating hardware shall be exposed and usable from both sides.

title: Closing Speed
body: Door and gate closing speed shall comply with 404.2.8.

title: Door Closers and Gate Closers
body: Door closers and gate closers shall be adjusted so that from an open position of 90 degrees, the time required to move the door to a position of 12 degrees from the latch is 5 seconds minimum.

title: Spring Hinges
body: Door and gate spring hinges shall be adjusted so that from the open position of 70 degrees, the door or gate shall move to the closed position in 1.5 seconds minimum.

title: Door and Gate Opening Force

title: Door and Gate Surfaces
body: Swinging door and gate surfaces within 10 inches (255 mm) of the finish floor or ground measured vertically shall have a smooth surface on the push side extending the full width of the door or gate. Parts creating horizontal or vertical joints in these surfaces shall be within 1/16 inch (1.6 mm) of the same plane as the other. Cavities created by added kick plates shall be capped.

title: Vision Lights
body: Doors, gates, and side lights adjacent to doors or gates, containing one or more glazing panels that permit viewing through the panels shall have the bottom of at least one glazed panel located 43 inches (1090 mm) maximum above the finish floor.

title: Automatic and Power-Assisted Doors and Gates
body: Automatic doors and automatic gates shall comply with 404.3. Full-powered automatic doors shall comply with ANSI/BHMA A156.10 (incorporated by reference, see “Referenced Standards” in Chapter 1). Low-energy and power-assisted doors shall comply with ANSI/BHMA A156.19 (1997 or 2002 edition) (incorporated by reference, see “Referenced Standards” in Chapter 1).

title: Clear Width
body: Doorways shall provide a clear opening of 32 inches (815 mm) minimum in power-on and power-off mode. The minimum clear width for automatic door systems in a doorway shall be based on the clear opening provided by all leaves in the open position.

title: Maneuvering Clearance
body: Clearances at power-assisted doors and gates shall comply with 404.2.4. Clearances at automatic doors and gates without standby power and serving an accessible means of egress shall comply with 404.2.4.

title: Thresholds
body: Thresholds and changes in level at doorways shall comply with 404.2.5.

title: Doors in Series and Gates in Series
body: Doors in series and gates in series shall comply with 404.2.6.

title: Controls
body: Manually operated controls shall comply with 309. The clear floor space adjacent to the control shall be located beyond the arc of the door swing.

title: Break Out Opening
body: Where doors and gates without standby power are a part of a means of egress, the clear break out opening at swinging or sliding doors and gates shall be 32 inches (815 mm) minimum when operated in emergency mode.

title: Revolving Doors, Revolving Gates, and Turnstiles
body: Revolving doors, revolving gates, and turnstiles shall not be part of an accessible route.

title: General
body: Ramps on accessible routes shall comply with 405.

title: Slope
body: Ramp runs shall have a running slope not steeper than 1:12.

title: Cross Slope
body: Cross slope of ramp runs shall not be steeper than 1:48.

title: Floor or Ground Surfaces
body: Floor or ground surfaces of ramp runs shall comply with 302. Changes in level other than the running slope and cross slope are not permitted on ramp runs.

title: Clear Width
body: The clear width of a ramp run and, where handrails are provided, the clear width between handrails shall be 36 inches (915 mm) minimum.

title: Rise
body: The rise for any ramp run shall be 30 inches (760 mm) maximum.

title: Landings
body: Ramps shall have landings at the top and the bottom of each ramp run. Landings shall comply with 405.7.

title: Slope
body: Landings shall comply with 302. Changes in level are not permitted.

title: Width
body: The landing clear width shall be at least as wide as the widest ramp run leading to the landing.

title: Length
body: The landing clear length shall be 60 inches (1525 mm) long minimum.

title: Change in Direction
body: Ramps that change direction between runs at landings shall have a clear landing 60 inches (1525 mm) minimum by 60 inches (1525 mm) minimum.

title: Doorways
body: Where doorways are located adjacent to a ramp landing, maneuvering clearances required by 404.2.4 and 404.3.2 shall be permitted to overlap the required landing area.

title: Handrails
body: Ramp runs with a rise greater than 6 inches (150 mm) shall have handrails complying with 505.

title: Edge Protection
body: Edge protection complying with 405.9.1 or 405.9.2 shall be provided on each side of ramp runs and at each side of ramp landings.

title: Extended Floor or Ground Surface
body: The floor or ground surface of the ramp run or landing shall extend 12 inches (305 mm) minimum beyond the inside face of a handrail complying with 505.

title: Curb or Barrier
body: A curb or barrier shall be provided that prevents the passage of a 4 inch (100 mm) diameter sphere, where any portion of the sphere is within 4 inches (100 mm) of the finish floor or ground surface.

title: Wet Conditions
body: Landings subject to wet conditions shall be designed to prevent the accumulation of water.

title: General
body: Curb ramps on accessible routes shall comply with 406, 405.2 through 405.5, and 405.10.

title: Counter Slope
body: Counter slopes of adjoining gutters and road surfaces immediately adjacent to the curb ramp shall not be steeper than 1:20. The adjacent surfaces at transitions at curb ramps to walks, gutters, and streets shall be at the same level.

title: Sides of Curb Ramps
body: Where provided, curb ramp flares shall not be steeper than 1:10.

title: Landings
body: Landings shall be provided at the tops of curb ramps. The landing clear length shall be 36 inches (915 mm) minimum. The landing clear width shall be at least as wide as the curb ramp, excluding flared sides, leading to the landing.

title: Location
body: Curb ramps and the flared sides of curb ramps shall be located so that they do not project into vehicular traffic lanes, parking spaces, or parking access aisles. Curb ramps at marked crossings shall be wholly contained within the markings, excluding any flared sides.

title: Diagonal Curb Ramps
body: Diagonal or corner type curb ramps with returned curbs or other well-defined edges shall have the edges parallel to the direction of pedestrian flow. The bottom of diagonal curb ramps shall have a clear space 48 inches (1220 mm) minimum outside active traffic lanes of the roadway. Diagonal curb ramps provided at marked crossings shall provide the 48 inches (1220 mm) minimum clear space within the markings. Diagonal curb ramps with flared sides shall have a segment of curb 24 inches (610 mm) long minimum located on each side of the curb ramp and within the marked crossing.

title: Islands
body: Raised islands in crossings shall be cut through level with the street or have curb ramps at both sides. Each curb ramp shall have a level area 48 inches (1220 mm) long minimum by 36 inches (915 mm) wide minimum at the top of the curb ramp in the part of the island intersected by the crossings. Each 48 inch (1220 mm) minimum by 36 inch (915 mm) minimum area shall be oriented so that the 48 inch (1220 mm) minimum length is in the direction of the running slope of the curb ramp it serves. The 48 inch (1220 mm) minimum by 36 inch (915 mm) minimum areas and the accessible route shall be permitted to overlap.

title: General
body: Elevators shall comply with 407 and with ASME A17.1 (incorporated by reference, see “Referenced Standards” in Chapter 1). They shall be passenger elevators as classified by ASME A17.1. Elevator operation shall be automatic.

title: Elevator Landing Requirements
body: Elevator landings shall comply with 407.2.

title: Call Controls
body: Where elevator call buttons or keypads are provided, they shall comply with 407.2.1 and 309.4. Call buttons shall be raised or flush.

title: Height
body: Call buttons and keypads shall be located within one of the reach ranges specified in 308, measured to the centerline of the highest operable part.

title: Size
body: Call buttons shall be 3/4 inch (19 mm) minimum in the smallest dimension.

title: Clear Floor or Ground Space
body: A clear floor or ground space complying with 305 shall be provided at call controls.

title: Location
body: The call button that designates the up direction shall be located above the call button that designates the down direction.

title: Signals
body: Call buttons shall have visible signals to indicate when each call is registered and when each call is answered.

title: Keypads
body: Where keypads are provided, keypads shall be in a standard telephone keypad arrangement and shall comply with 407.4.7.2.

title: Hall Signals
body: Hall signals, including in-car signals, shall comply with 407.2.2.

title: Visible and Audible Signals
body: A visible and audible signal shall be provided at each hoistway entrance to indicate which car is answering a call and the car’s direction of travel. Where in-car signals are provided, they shall be visible from the floor area adjacent to the hall call buttons.

title: Visible Signals
body: Visible signal fixtures shall be centered at 72 inches (1830 mm) minimum above the finish floor or ground. The visible signal elements shall be 2 1/2 inches (64 mm) minimum measured along the vertical centerline of the element. Signals shall be visible from the floor area adjacent to the hall call button.

title: Audible Signals
body: Audible signals shall sound once for the up direction and twice for the down direction, or shall have verbal annunciators that indicate the direction of elevator car travel. Audible signals shall have a frequency of 1500 Hz maximum. Verbal annunciators shall have a frequency of 300 Hz minimum and 3000 Hz maximum. The audible signal and verbal annunciator shall be 10 dB minimum above ambient, but shall not exceed 80 dB, measured at the hall call button.

title: Differentiation
body: Each destination-oriented elevator in a bank of elevators shall have audible and visible means for differentiation.

title: Hoistway Signs
body: Signs at elevator hoistways shall comply with 407.2.3.

title: Floor Designation
body: Floor designations complying with 703.2 and 703.4.1 shall be provided on both jambs of elevator hoistway entrances. Floor designations shall be provided in both tactile characters and braille. Tactile characters shall be 2 inches (51 mm) high minimum. A tactile star shall be provided on both jambs at the main entry level.

title: Car Designations
body: Destination-oriented elevators shall provide tactile car identification complying with 703.2 on both jambs of the hoistway immediately below the floor designation. Car designations shall be provided in both tactile characters and braille. Tactile characters shall be 2 inches (51 mm) high minimum.

title: Elevator Door Requirements
body: Hoistway and car doors shall comply with 407.3.

title: Type
body: Elevator doors shall be the horizontal sliding type. Car gates shall be prohibited.

title: Operation
body: Elevator hoistway and car doors shall open and close automatically.

title: Reopening Device
body: Elevator doors shall be provided with a reopening device complying with 407.3.3 that shall stop and reopen a car door and hoistway door automatically if the door becomes obstructed by an object or person.

title: Height
body: The device shall be activated by sensing an obstruction passing through the opening at 5 inches (125 mm) nominal and 29 inches (735 mm) nominal above the finish floor.

title: Contact
body: The device shall not require physical contact to be activated, although contact is permitted to occur before the door reverses.

title: Duration
body: Door reopening devices shall remain effective for 20 seconds minimum.

body: The minimum acceptable time from notification that a car is answering a call or notification of the car assigned at the means for the entry of destination information until the doors of that car start to close shall be calculated from the following equation:

title: Door Delay
body: Elevator doors shall remain fully open in response to a car call for 3 seconds minimum.

title: Width
body: The width of elevator doors shall comply with Table 407.4.1.

title: Elevator Car Requirements
body: Elevator cars shall comply with 407.4.

title: Car Dimensions
body: Inside dimensions of elevator cars and clear width of elevator doors shall comply with Table 407.4.1.

title: Floor Surfaces
body: Floor surfaces in elevator cars shall comply with 302 and 303.

title: Platform to Hoistway Clearance
body: The clearance between the car platform sill and the edge of any hoistway landing shall be 1 1/4 inch (32 mm) maximum.

title: Leveling
body: Each car shall be equipped with a self-leveling feature that will automatically bring and maintain the car at floor landings within a tolerance of 1/2 inch (13 mm) under rated loading to zero loading conditions.

title: Illumination
body: The level of illumination at the car controls, platform, car threshold and car landing sill shall be 5 foot candles (54 lux) minimum.

title: Elevator Car Controls
body: Where provided, elevator car controls shall comply with 407.4.6 and 309.4.

title: Location
body: Controls shall be located within one of the reach ranges specified in 308.

title: Buttons
body: Car control buttons with floor designations shall comply with 407.4.6.2 and shall be raised or flush.

title: Size
body: Buttons shall be 3/4 inch (19 mm) minimum in their smallest dimension.

title: Arrangement
body: Buttons shall be arranged with numbers in ascending order. When two or more columns of buttons are provided they shall read from left to right.

title: Keypads
body: Car control keypads shall be in a standard telephone keypad arrangement and shall comply with 407.4.7.2.

title: Emergency Controls
body: Emergency controls shall comply with 407.4.6.4.

title: Height
body: Emergency control buttons shall have their centerlines 35 inches (890 mm) minimum above the finish floor.

title: Location
body: Emergency controls, including the emergency alarm, shall be grouped at the bottom of the panel.

title: Designations and Indicators of Car Controls
body: Designations and indicators of car controls shall comply with 407.4.7.

title: Buttons
body: Car control buttons shall comply with 407.4.7.1.

title: Type
body: Control buttons shall be identified by tactile characters complying with 703.2.

title: Location
body: Raised character and braille designations shall be placed immediately to the left of the control button to which the designations apply.

title: Symbols
body: The control button for the emergency stop, alarm, door open, door close, main entry floor, and phone, shall be identified with tactile symbols as shown in Table 407.4.7.1.3.

title: Visible Indicators
body: Buttons with floor designations shall be provided with visible indicators to show that a call has been registered. The visible indication shall extinguish when the car arrives at the designated floor.

title: Keypads
body: Keypads shall be identified by characters complying with 703.5 and shall be centered on the corresponding keypad button. The number five key shall have a single raised dot. The dot shall be 0.118 inch (3 mm) to 0.120 inch (3.05 mm) base diameter and in other aspects comply with Table 703.3.1.

title: Car Position Indicators
body: Audible and visible car position indicators shall be provided in elevator cars.

title: Visible Indicators
body: Visible indicators shall comply with 407.4.8.1.

title: Size
body: Characters shall be 1/2 inch (13 mm) high minimum.

title: Location
body: Indicators shall be located above the car control panel or above the door.

title: Floor Arrival
body: As the car passes a floor and when a car stops at a floor served by the elevator, the corresponding character shall illuminate.

title: Destination Indicator
body: In destination-oriented elevators, a display shall be provided in the car with visible indicators to show car destinations.

title: Audible Indicators
body: Audible indicators shall comply with 407.4.8.2.

title: Signal Type
body: The signal shall be an automatic verbal annunciator which announces the floor at which the car is about to stop.

title: Signal Level
body: The verbal annunciator shall be 10 dB minimum above ambient, but shall not exceed 80 dB, measured at the annunciator.

title: Frequency
body: The verbal annunciator shall have a frequency of 300 Hz minimum to 3000 Hz maximum.

title: Emergency Communication
body: Emergency two-way communication systems shall comply with 308. Tactile symbols and characters shall be provided adjacent to the device and shall comply with 703.2.

title: General
body: Limited-use/limited-application elevators shall comply with 408 and with ASME A17.1 (incorporated by reference, see “Referenced Standards” in Chapter 1). They shall be passenger elevators as classified by ASME A17.1. Elevator operation shall be automatic.

title: Elevator Landings
body: Landings serving limited-use/limited-application elevators shall comply with 408.2.

title: Call Buttons
body: Elevator call buttons and keypads shall comply with 407.2.1.

title: Hall Signals
body: Hall signals shall comply with 407.2.2.

title: Hoistway Signs
body: Signs at elevator hoistways shall comply with 407.2.3.1.

title: Elevator Doors
body: Elevator hoistway doors shall comply with 408.3.

title: Sliding Doors
body: Sliding hoistway and car doors shall comply with 407.3.1 through 407.3.3 and 408.4.1.

title: Swinging Doors
body: Swinging hoistway doors shall open and close automatically and shall comply with 404, 407.3.2 and 408.3.2.

title: Power Operation
body: Swinging doors shall be power-operated and shall comply with ANSI/BHMA A156.19 (1997 or 2002 edition) (incorporated by reference, see “Referenced Standards” in Chapter 1).

title: Duration
body: Power-operated swinging doors shall remain open for 20 seconds minimum when activated.

title: Elevator Cars
body: Elevator cars shall comply with 408.4.

title: Car Dimensions and Doors
body: Elevator cars shall provide a clear width 42 inches (1065 mm) minimum and a clear depth 54 inches (1370 mm) minimum. Car doors shall be positioned at the narrow ends of cars and shall provide 32 inches (815 mm) minimum clear width.

title: Floor Surfaces
body: Floor surfaces in elevator cars shall comply with 302 and 303.

title: Platform to Hoistway Clearance
body: The platform to hoistway clearance shall comply with 407.4.3.

title: Leveling
body: Elevator car leveling shall comply with 407.4.4.

title: Illumination
body: Elevator car illumination shall comply with 407.4.5.

title: Car Controls
body: Elevator car controls shall comply with 407.4.6. Control panels shall be centered on a side wall.

title: Designations and Indicators of Car Controls
body: Designations and indicators of car controls shall comply with 407.4.7.

title: Emergency Communications
body: Car emergency signaling devices complying with 407.4.9 shall be provided.

title: General
body: Private residence elevators that are provided within a residential dwelling unit required to provide mobility features complying with 809.2 through 809.4 shall comply with 409 and with ASME A17.1 (incorporated by reference, see “Referenced Standards” in Chapter 1). They shall be passenger elevators as classified by ASME A17.1. Elevator operation shall be automatic.

title: Call Buttons
body: Call buttons shall be 3/4 inch (19 mm) minimum in the smallest dimension and shall comply with 309.

title: Elevator Doors
body: Hoistway doors, car doors, and car gates shall comply with 409.3 and 404.

title: Power Operation
body: Elevator car and hoistway doors and gates shall be power operated and shall comply with ANSI/BHMA A156.19 (1997 or 2002 edition) (incorporated by reference, see “Referenced Standards” in Chapter 1). Power operated doors and gates shall remain open for 20 seconds minimum when activated.

title: Location
body: Elevator car doors or gates shall be positioned at the narrow end of the clear floor spaces required by 409.4.1.

title: Elevator Cars
body: Private residence elevator cars shall comply with 409.4.

title: Inside Dimensions of Elevator Cars
body: Elevator cars shall provide a clear floor space of 36 inches (915 mm) minimum by 48 inches (1220 mm) minimum and shall comply with 305.

title: Floor Surfaces
body: Floor surfaces in elevator cars shall comply with 302 and 303.

title: Platform to Hoistway Clearance
body: The clearance between the car platform and the edge of any landing sill shall be 1 1/2 inch (38 mm) maximum.

title: Leveling
body: Each car shall automatically stop at a floor landing within a tolerance of 1/2 inch (13 mm) under rated loading to zero loading conditions.

title: Illumination Levels
body: Elevator car illumination shall comply with 407.4.5.

title: Car Controls
body: Elevator car control buttons shall comply with 409.4.6, 309.3, 309.4, and shall be raised or flush.

title: Size
body: Control buttons shall be 3/4 inch (19 mm) minimum in their smallest dimension.

title: Location
body: Control panels shall be on a side wall, 12 inches (305 mm) minimum from any adjacent wall.

title: Emergency Communications
body: Emergency two-way communication systems shall comply with 409.4.7.

title: Type
body: A telephone and emergency signal device shall be provided in the car.

title: Operable Parts
body: The telephone and emergency signaling device shall comply with 309.3 and 309.4.

title: Compartment
body: If the telephone or device is in a closed compartment, the compartment door hardware shall comply with 309.

title: Cord
body: The telephone cord shall be 29 inches (735 mm) long minimum.

title: General
body: Platform lifts shall comply with ASME A18.1 (1999 edition or 2003 edition) (incorporated by reference, see “Referenced Standards” in Chapter 1). Platform lifts shall not be attendant-operated and shall provide unassisted entry and exit from the lift.

title: Floor Surfaces
body: Floor surfaces in platform lifts shall comply with 302 and 303.

title: Clear Floor Space
body: Clear floor space in platform lifts shall comply with 305.

title: Platform to Runway Clearance
body: The clearance between the platform sill and the edge of any runway landing shall be 1 inch (32 mm) maximum.

title: Operable Parts
body: Controls for platform lifts shall comply with 309.

title: Doors and Gates
body: Platform lifts shall have low-energy power-operated doors or gates complying with 404.3. Doors shall remain open for 20 seconds minimum. End doors and gates shall provide a clear width 32 inches (815 mm) minimum. Side doors and gates shall provide a clear width 42 inches (1065 mm) minimum.

title: Scope
body: The provisions of Chapter 5 shall apply where required by Chapter 2 or where referenced by a requirement in this document.

title: General
body: Car and van parking spaces shall comply with 502. Where parking spaces are marked with lines, width measurements of parking spaces and access aisles shall be made from the centerline of the markings.

title: Vehicle Spaces
body: Car parking spaces shall be 96 inches (2440 mm) wide minimum and van parking spaces shall be 132 inches (3350 mm) wide minimum, shall be marked to define the width, and shall have an adjacent access aisle complying with 502.3.

title: Access Aisle
body: Access aisles serving parking spaces shall comply with 502.3. Access aisles shall adjoin an accessible route. Two parking spaces shall be permitted to share a common access aisle.

title: Width
body: Access aisles serving car and van parking spaces shall be 60 inches (1525 mm) wide minimum.

title: Length
body: Access aisles shall extend the full length of the parking spaces they serve.

title: Marking
body: Access aisles shall be marked so as to discourage parking in them.

title: Location
body: Access aisles shall not overlap the vehicular way. Access aisles shall be permitted to be placed on either side of the parking space except for angled van parking spaces which shall have access aisles located on the passenger side of the parking spaces.

title: Floor or Ground Surfaces
body: Parking spaces and access aisles serving them shall comply with 302. Access aisles shall be at the same level as the parking spaces they serve. Changes in level are not permitted.

title: Vertical Clearance
body: Parking spaces for vans and access aisles and vehicular routes serving them shall provide a vertical clearance of 98 inches (2490 mm) minimum.

title: Identification
body: Parking space identification signs shall include the International Symbol of Accessibility complying with 703.7.2.1. Signs identifying van parking spaces shall contain the designation “van accessible.” Signs shall be 60 inches (1525 mm) minimum above the finish floor or ground surface measured to the bottom of the sign.

title: Relationship to Accessible Routes
body: Parking spaces and access aisles shall be designed so that cars and vans, when parked, cannot obstruct the required clear width of adjacent accessible routes.

title: General
body: Passenger loading zones shall comply with 503.

title: Vehicle Pull-Up Space
body: Passenger loading zones shall provide a vehicular pull-up space 96 inches (2440 mm) wide minimum and 20 feet (6100 mm) long minimum.

title: Access Aisle
body: Passenger loading zones shall provide access aisles complying with 503 adjacent to the vehicle pull-up space. Access aisles shall adjoin an accessible route and shall not overlap the vehicular way.

title: Width
body: Access aisles serving vehicle pull-up spaces shall be 60 inches (1525 mm) wide minimum.

title: Length
body: Access aisles shall extend the full length of the vehicle pull-up spaces they serve.

title: Marking
body: Access aisles shall be marked so as to discourage parking in them.

title: Floor and Ground Surfaces
body: Vehicle pull-up spaces and access aisles serving them shall comply with 302. Access aisles shall be at the same level as the vehicle pull-up space they serve. Changes in level are not permitted.

title: Vertical Clearance
body: Vehicle pull-up spaces, access aisles serving them, and a vehicular route from an entrance to the passenger loading zone, and from the passenger loading zone to a vehicular exit shall provide a vertical clearance of 114 inches (2895 mm) minimum.

title: General
body: Stairs shall comply with 504.

title: Treads and Risers
body: All steps on a flight of stairs shall have uniform riser heights and uniform tread depths. Risers shall be 4 inches (100 mm) high minimum and 7 inches (180 mm) high maximum. Treads shall be 11 inches (280 mm) deep minimum.

title: Open Risers
body: Open risers are not permitted.

title: Tread Surface
body: Stair treads shall comply with 302. Changes in level are not permitted.

title: Nosings
body: The radius of curvature at the leading edge of the tread shall be 1/2 inch (13 mm) maximum. Nosings that project beyond risers shall have the underside of the leading edge curved or beveled. Risers shall be permitted to slope under the tread at an angle of 30 degrees maximum from vertical. The permitted projection of the nosing shall extend 1 1/2 inches (38 mm) maximum over the tread below.

title: Handrails
body: Stairs shall have handrails complying with 505.

title: Wet Conditions
body: Stair treads and landings subject to wet conditions shall be designed to prevent the accumulation of water.

title: General
body: Handrails provided along walking surfaces complying with 403, required at ramps complying with 405, and required at stairs complying with 504 shall comply with 505.

title: Where Required
body: Handrails shall be provided on both sides of stairs and ramps.

title: Continuity
body: Handrails shall be continuous within the full length of each stair flight or ramp run. Inside handrails on switchback or dogleg stairs and ramps shall be continuous between flights or runs.

title: Height
body: Top of gripping surfaces of handrails shall be 34 inches (865 mm) minimum and 38 inches (965 mm) maximum vertically above walking surfaces, stair nosings, and ramp surfaces. Handrails shall be at a consistent height above walking surfaces, stair nosings, and ramp surfaces.

title: Clearance
body: Clearance between handrail gripping surfaces and adjacent surfaces shall be 1 1/2 inches (38 mm) minimum.

title: Gripping Surface
body: Handrail gripping surfaces shall be continuous along their length and shall not be obstructed along their tops or sides. The bottoms of handrail gripping surfaces shall not be obstructed for more than 20 percent of their length. Where provided, horizontal projections shall occur 1 1/2 inches (38 mm) minimum below the bottom of the handrail gripping surface.

title: Cross Section
body: Handrail gripping surfaces shall have a cross section complying with 505.7.1 or 505.7.2.

title: Circular Cross Section
body: Handrail gripping surfaces with a circular cross section shall have an outside diameter of 1 1/4 inches (32 mm) minimum and 2 inches (51 mm) maximum.

title: Non-Circular Cross Sections
body: Handrail gripping surfaces with a non-circular cross section shall have a perimeter dimension of 4 inches (100 mm) minimum and 6 1/4 inches (160 mm) maximum, and a cross-section dimension of 2 1/4 inches (57 mm) maximum.

title: Surfaces
body: Handrail gripping surfaces and any surfaces adjacent to them shall be free of sharp or abrasive elements and shall have rounded edges.

title: Fittings
body: Handrails shall not rotate within their fittings.

title: Handrail Extensions
body: Handrail gripping surfaces shall extend beyond and in the same direction of stair flights and ramp runs in accordance with 505.10.

title: Top and Bottom Extension at Ramps
body: Ramp handrails shall extend horizontally above the landing for 12 inches (305 mm) minimum beyond the top and bottom of ramp runs. Extensions shall return to a wall, guard, or the landing surface, or shall be continuous to the handrail of an adjacent ramp run.

title: Top Extension at Stairs
body: At the top of a stair flight, handrails shall extend horizontally above the landing for 12 inches (305 mm) minimum beginning directly above the first riser nosing. Extensions shall return to a wall, guard, or the landing surface, or shall be continuous to the handrail of an adjacent stair flight.

title: Bottom Extension at Stairs
body: At the bottom of a stair flight, handrails shall extend at the slope of the stair flight for a horizontal distance at least equal to one tread depth beyond the last riser nosing. Extension shall return to a wall, guard, or the landing surface, or shall be continuous to the handrail of an adjacent stair flight.

title: Scope
body: The provisions of Chapter 6 shall apply where required by Chapter 2 or where referenced by a requirement in this document.

title: General
body: Drinking fountains shall comply with 307 and 602.

title: Clear Floor Space
body: Units shall have a clear floor or ground space complying with 305 positioned for a forward approach and centered on the unit. Knee and toe clearance complying with 306 shall be provided.

title: Operable Parts
body: Operable parts shall comply with 309.

title: Spout Height
body: Spout outlets shall be 36 inches (915 mm) maximum above the finish floor or ground.

title: Spout Location
body: The spout shall be located 15 inches (380 mm) minimum from the vertical support and 5 inches (125 mm) maximum from the front edge of the unit, including bumpers.

title: Water Flow
body: The spout shall provide a flow of water 4 inches (100 mm) high minimum and shall be located 5 inches (125 mm) maximum from the front of the unit. The angle of the water stream shall be measured horizontally relative to the front face of the unit. Where spouts are located less than 3 inches (75 mm) of the front of the unit, the angle of the water stream shall be 30 degrees maximum. Where spouts are located between 3 inches (75 mm) and 5 inches (125 mm) maximum from the front of the unit, the angle of the water stream shall be 15 degrees maximum.

title: Drinking Fountains for Standing Persons
body: Spout outlets of drinking fountains for standing persons shall be 38 inches (965 mm) minimum and 43 inches (1090 mm) maximum above the finish floor or ground.

title: General
body: Toilet and bathing rooms shall comply with 603.

title: Clearances
body: Clearances shall comply with 603.2.

title: Turning Space
body: Turning space complying with 304 shall be provided within the room.

title: Overlap
body: Required clear floor spaces, clearance at fixtures, and turning space shall be permitted to overlap.

title: Door Swing
body: Doors shall not swing into the clear floor space or clearance required for any fixture. Doors shall be permitted to swing into the required turning space.

title: Mirrors
body: Mirrors located above lavatories or countertops shall be installed with the bottom edge of the reflecting surface 40 inches (1015 mm) maximum above the finish floor or ground. Mirrors not located above lavatories or countertops shall be installed with the bottom edge of the reflecting surface 35 inches (890 mm) maximum above the finish floor or ground.

title: Coat Hooks and Shelves
body: Coat hooks shall be located within one of the reach ranges specified in 308. Shelves shall be located 40 inches (1015 mm) minimum and 48 inches (1220 mm) maximum above the finish floor.

title: General
body: Water closets and toilet compartments shall comply with 604.2 through 604.8.

title: Location
body: The water closet shall be positioned with a wall or partition to the rear and to one side. The centerline of the water closet shall be 16 inches (405 mm) minimum to 18 inches (455 mm) maximum from the side wall or partition, except that the water closet shall be 17 inches (430 mm) minimum and 19 inches (485 mm) maximum from the side wall or partition in the ambulatory accessible toilet compartment specified in 604.8.2. Water closets shall be arranged for a left-hand or right-hand approach.

title: Clearance
body: Clearances around water closets and in toilet compartments shall comply with 604.3.

title: Size
body: Clearance around a water closet shall be 60 inches (1525 mm) minimum measured perpendicular from the side wall and 56 inches (1420 mm) minimum measured perpendicular from the rear wall.

title: Overlap
body: The required clearance around the water closet shall be permitted to overlap the water closet, associated grab bars, dispensers, sanitary napkin disposal units, coat hooks, shelves, accessible routes, clear floor space and clearances required at other fixtures, and the turning space. No other fixtures or obstructions shall be located within the required water closet clearance.

title: Seats
body: The seat height of a water closet above the finish floor shall be 17 inches (430 mm) minimum and 19 inches (485 mm) maximum measured to the top of the seat. Seats shall not be sprung to return to a lifted position.

title: Grab Bars
body: Grab bars for water closets shall comply with 609. Grab bars shall be provided on the side wall closest to the water closet and on the rear wall.

title: Side Wall
body: The side wall grab bar shall be 42 inches (1065 mm) long minimum, located 12 inches (305 mm) maximum from the rear wall and extending 54 inches (1370 mm) minimum from the rear wall.

title: Rear Wall
body: The rear wall grab bar shall be 36 inches (915 mm) long minimum and extend from the centerline of the water closet 12 inches (305 mm) minimum on one side and 24 inches (610 mm) minimum on the other side.

title: Flush Controls
body: Flush controls shall be hand operated or automatic. Hand operated flush controls shall comply with 309. Flush controls shall be located on the open side of the water closet except in ambulatory accessible compartments complying with 604.8.2.

title: Dispensers
body: Toilet paper dispensers shall comply with 309.4 and shall be 7 inches (180 mm) minimum and 9 inches (230 mm) maximum in front of the water closet measured to the centerline of the dispenser. The outlet of the dispenser shall be 15 inches (380 mm) minimum and 48 inches (1220 mm) maximum above the finish floor and shall not be located behind grab bars. Dispensers shall not be of a type that controls delivery or that does not allow continuous paper flow.

title: Toilet Compartments
body: Wheelchair accessible toilet compartments shall meet the requirements of 604.8.1 and 604.8.3. Compartments containing more than one plumbing fixture shall comply with 603. Ambulatory accessible compartments shall comply with 604.8.2 and 604.8.3.

title: Wheelchair Accessible Compartments
body: Wheelchair accessible compartments shall comply with 604.8.1.

title: Size
body: Wheelchair accessible compartments shall be 60 inches (1525 mm) wide minimum measured perpendicular to the side wall, and 56 inches (1420 mm) deep minimum for wall hung water closets and 59 inches (1500 mm) deep minimum for floor mounted water closets measured perpendicular to the rear wall. Wheelchair accessible compartments for children’s use shall be 60 inches (1525 mm) wide minimum measured perpendicular to the side wall, and 59 inches (1500 mm) deep minimum for wall hung and floor mounted water closets measured perpendicular to the rear wall.

title: Doors
body: Toilet compartment doors, including door hardware, shall comply with 404 except that if the approach is to the latch side of the compartment door, clearance between the door side of the compartment and any obstruction shall be 42 inches (1065 mm) minimum. Doors shall be located in the front partition or in the side wall or partition farthest from the water closet. Where located in the front partition, the door opening shall be 4 inches (100 mm) maximum from the side wall or partition farthest from the water closet. Where located in the side wall or partition, the door opening shall be 4 inches (100 mm) maximum from the front partition. The door shall be self-closing. A door pull complying with 404.2.7 shall be placed on both sides of the door near the latch. Toilet compartment doors shall not swing into the minimum required compartment area.

title: Approach
body: Compartments shall be arranged for left-hand or right-hand approach to the water closet.

title: Toe Clearance
body: The front partition and at least one side partition shall provide a toe clearance of 9 inches (230 mm) minimum above the finish floor and 6 inches (150 mm) deep minimum beyond the compartment-side face of the partition, exclusive of partition support members. Compartments for children’s use shall provide a toe clearance of 12 inches (305 mm) minimum above the finish floor.

title: Grab Bars
body: Grab bars shall comply with 609. A side-wall grab bar complying with 604.5.1 shall be provided and shall be located on the wall closest to the water closet. In addition, a rear-wall grab bar complying with 604.5.2 shall be provided.

title: Ambulatory Accessible Compartments
body: Ambulatory accessible compartments shall comply with 604.8.2.

title: Size
body: Ambulatory accessible compartments shall have a depth of 60 inches (1525 mm) minimum and a width of 35 inches (890 mm) minimum and 37 inches (940 mm) maximum.

title: Doors
body: Toilet compartment doors, including door hardware, shall comply with 404, except that if the approach is to the latch side of the compartment door, clearance between the door side of the compartment and any obstruction shall be 42 inches (1065 mm) minimum. The door shall be self-closing. A door pull complying with 404.2.7 shall be placed on both sides of the door near the latch. Toilet compartment doors shall not swing into the minimum required compartment area.

title: Grab Bars
body: Grab bars shall comply with 609. A side-wall grab bar complying with 604.5.1 shall be provided on both sides of the compartment.

title: Coat Hooks and Shelves
body: Coat hooks shall be located within one of the reach ranges specified in 308. Shelves shall be located 40 inches (1015 mm) minimum and 48 inches (1220 mm) maximum above the finish floor.

title: Water Closets and Toilet Compartments for Children’s Use
body: Water closets and toilet compartments for children’s use shall comply with 604.9.

title: Location
body: The water closet shall be located with a wall or partition to the rear and to one side. The centerline of the water closet shall be 12 inches (305 mm) minimum and 18 inches (455 mm) maximum from the side wall or partition, except that the water closet shall be 17 inches (430 mm) minimum and 19 inches (485 mm) maximum from the side wall or partition in the ambulatory accessible toilet compartment specified in 604.8.2. Compartments shall be arranged for left-hand or right-hand approach to the water closet.

title: Clearance
body: Clearance around a water closet shall comply with 604.3.

title: Height
body: The height of water closets shall be 11 inches (280 mm) minimum and 17 inches (430 mm) maximum measured to the top of the seat. Seats shall not be sprung to return to a lifted position.

title: Grab Bars
body: Grab bars for water closets shall comply with 604.5.

title: Flush Controls
body: Flush controls shall be hand operated or automatic. Hand operated flush controls shall comply with 309.2 and 309.4 and shall be installed 36 inches (915 mm) maximum above the finish floor. Flush controls shall be located on the open side of the water closet except in ambulatory accessible compartments complying with 604.8.2.

title: Dispensers
body: Toilet paper dispensers shall comply with 309.4 and shall be 7 inches (180 mm) minimum and 9 inches (230 mm) maximum in front of the water closet measured to the centerline of the dispenser. The outlet of the dispenser shall be 14 inches (355 mm) minimum and 19 inches (485 mm) maximum above the finish floor. There shall be a clearance of 1 1/2 inches (38 mm) minimum below the grab bar. Dispensers shall not be of a type that controls delivery or that does not allow continuous paper flow.

title: Toilet Compartments
body: Toilet compartments shall comply with 604.8.

title: General
body: Urinals shall comply with 605.

title: Height and Depth
body: Urinals shall be the stall-type or the wall-hung type with the rim 17 inches (430 mm) maximum above the finish floor or ground. Urinals shall be 13 1/2 inches (345 mm) deep minimum measured from the outer face of the urinal rim to the back of the fixture.

title: Clear Floor Space
body: A clear floor or ground space complying with 305 positioned for forward approach shall be provided.

title: Flush Controls
body: Flush controls shall be hand operated or automatic. Hand operated flush controls shall comply with 309.

title: General
body: Lavatories and sinks shall comply with 606.

title: Clear Floor Space
body: A clear floor space complying with 305, positioned for a forward approach, and knee and toe clearance complying with 306 shall be provided.

title: Height
body: Lavatories and sinks shall be installed with the front of the higher of the rim or counter surface 34 inches (865 mm) maximum above the finish floor or ground.

title: Faucets
body: Controls for faucets shall comply with 309. Hand-operated metering faucets shall remain open for 10 seconds minimum.

title: Exposed Pipes and Surfaces
body: Water supply and drain pipes under lavatories and sinks shall be insulated or otherwise configured to protect against contact. There shall be no sharp or abrasive surfaces under lavatories and sinks.

title: General
body: Bathtubs shall comply with 607.

title: Clearance
body: Clearance in front of bathtubs shall extend the length of the bathtub and shall be 30 inches (760 mm) wide minimum. A lavatory complying with 606 shall be permitted at the control end of the clearance. Where a permanent seat is provided at the head end of the bathtub, the clearance shall extend 12 inches (305 mm) minimum beyond the wall at the head end of the bathtub.

title: Seat
body: A permanent seat at the head end of the bathtub or a removable in-tub seat shall be provided. Seats shall comply with 610.

title: Grab Bars
body: Grab bars for bathtubs shall comply with 609 and shall be provided in accordance with 607.4.1 or 607.4.2.

title: Bathtubs With Permanent Seats
body: For bathtubs with permanent seats, grab bars shall be provided in accordance with 607.4.1.

title: Back Wall
body: Two grab bars shall be installed on the back wall, one located in accordance with 609.4 and the other located 8 inches (205 mm) minimum and 10 inches (255 mm) maximum above the rim of the bathtub. Each grab bar shall be installed 15 inches (380 mm) maximum from the head end wall and 12 inches (305 mm) maximum from the control end wall.

title: Control End Wall
body: A grab bar 24 inches (610 mm) long minimum shall be installed on the control end wall at the front edge of the bathtub.

title: Bathtubs Without Permanent Seats
body: For bathtubs without permanent seats, grab bars shall comply with 607.4.2.

title: Back Wall
body: Two grab bars shall be installed on the back wall, one located in accordance with 609.4 and other located 8 inches (205 mm) minimum and 10 inches (255 mm) maximum above the rim of the bathtub. Each grab bar shall be 24 inches (610 mm) long minimum and shall be installed 24 inches (610 mm) maximum from the head end wall and 12 inches (305 mm) maximum from the control end wall.

title: Control End Wall
body: A grab bar 24 inches (610 mm) long minimum shall be installed on the control end wall at the front edge of the bathtub.

title: Head End Wall
body: A grab bar 12 inches (305 mm) long minimum shall be installed on the head end wall at the front edge of the bathtub.

title: Controls
body: Controls, other than drain stoppers, shall be located on an end wall. Controls shall be between the bathtub rim and grab bar, and between the open side of the bathtub and the centerline of the width of the bathtub. Controls shall comply with 309.4.

title: Shower Spray Unit and Water
body: A shower spray unit with a hose 59 inches (1500 mm) long minimum that can be used both as a fixed-position shower head and as a hand-held shower shall be provided. The shower spray unit shall have an on/off control with a non-positive shut-off. If an adjustable-height shower head on a vertical bar is used, the bar shall be installed so as not to obstruct the use of grab bars. Bathtub shower spray units shall deliver water that is 120°F (49°C) maximum.

title: Bathtub Enclosures
body: Enclosures for bathtubs shall not obstruct controls, faucets, shower and spray units or obstruct transfer from wheelchairs onto bathtub seats or into bathtubs. Enclosures on bathtubs shall not have tracks installed on the rim of the open face of the bathtub.

title: General
body: Shower compartments shall comply with 608.

title: Size and Clearances for Shower Compartments
body: Shower compartments shall have sizes and clearances complying with 608.2.

title: Transfer Type Shower Compartments
body: Transfer type shower compartments shall be 36 inches (915 mm) by 36 inches (915 mm) clear inside dimensions measured at the center points of opposing sides and shall have a 36 inch (915 mm) wide minimum entry on the face of the shower compartment. Clearance of 36 inches (915 mm) wide minimum by 48 inches (1220 mm) long minimum measured from the control wall shall be provided.

title: Standard Roll-In Type Shower Compartments
body: Standard roll-in type shower compartments shall be 30 inches (760 mm) wide minimum by 60 inches (1525 mm) deep minimum clear inside dimensions measured at center points of opposing sides and shall have a 60 inches (1525 mm) wide minimum entry on the face of the shower compartment.

title: Clearance
body: A 30 inch (760 mm) wide minimum by 60 inch (1525 mm) long minimum clearance shall be provided adjacent to the open face of the shower compartment.

title: Alternate Roll-In Type Shower Compartments
body: Alternate roll-in type shower compartments shall be 36 inches (915 mm) wide and 60 inches (1525 mm) deep minimum clear inside dimensions measured at center points of opposing sides. A 36 inch (915 mm) wide minimum entry shall be provided at one end of the long side of the compartment.

title: Grab Bars
body: Grab bars shall comply with 609 and shall be provided in accordance with 608.3. Where multiple grab bars are used, required horizontal grab bars shall be installed at the same height above the finish floor.

title: Transfer Type Shower Compartments
body: In transfer type compartments, grab bars shall be provided across the control wall and back wall to a point 18 inches (455 mm) from the control wall.

title: Standard Roll-In Type Shower Compartments
body: Where a seat is provided in standard roll-in type shower compartments, grab bars shall be provided on the back wall and the side wall opposite the seat. Grab bars shall not be provided above the seat. Where a seat is not provided in standard roll-in type shower compartments, grab bars shall be provided on three walls. Grab bars shall be installed 6 inches (150 mm) maximum from adjacent walls.

title: Alternate Roll-In Type Shower Compartments
body: In alternate roll-in type shower compartments, grab bars shall be provided on the back wall and the side wall farthest from the compartment entry. Grab bars shall not be provided above the seat. Grab bars shall be installed 6 inches (150 mm) maximum from adjacent walls.

title: Seats
body: A folding or non-folding seat shall be provided in transfer type shower compartments. A folding seat shall be provided in roll-in type showers required in transient lodging guest rooms with mobility features complying with 806.2. Seats shall comply with 610.

title: Controls
body: Controls, faucets, and shower spray units shall comply with 309.4.

title: Transfer Type Shower Compartments
body: In transfer type shower compartments, the controls, faucets, and shower spray unit shall be installed on the side wall opposite the seat 38 inches (965 mm) minimum and 48 inches (1220 mm) maximum above the shower floor and shall be located on the control wall 15 inches (380 mm) maximum from the centerline of the seat toward the shower opening.

title: Standard Roll-In Type Shower Compartments
body: In standard roll-in type shower compartments, the controls, faucets, and shower spray unit shall be located above the grab bar, but no higher than 48 inches (1220 mm) above the shower floor. Where a seat is provided, the controls, faucets, and shower spray unit shall be installed on the back wall adjacent to the seat wall and shall be located 27 inches (685 mm) maximum from the seat wall.

title: Alternate Roll-In Type Shower Compartments
body: In alternate roll-in type shower compartments, the controls, faucets, and shower spray unit shall be located above the grab bar, but no higher than 48 inches (1220 mm) above the shower floor. Where a seat is provided, the controls, faucets, and shower spray unit shall be located on the side wall adjacent to the seat 27 inches (685 mm) maximum from the side wall behind the seat or shall be located on the back wall opposite the seat 15 inches (380 mm) maximum, left or right, of the centerline of the seat. Where a seat is not provided, the controls, faucets, and shower spray unit shall be installed on the side wall farthest from the compartment entry.

title: Shower Spray Unit and Water
body: A shower spray unit with a hose 59 inches (1500 mm) long minimum that can be used both as a fixed-position shower head and as a hand-held shower shall be provided. The shower spray unit shall have an on/off control with a non-positive shut-off. If an adjustable-height shower head on a vertical bar is used, the bar shall be installed so as not to obstruct the use of grab bars. Shower spray units shall deliver water that is 120°F (49°C) maximum.

title: Thresholds
body: Thresholds in roll-in type shower compartments shall be 1/2 inch (13 mm) high maximum in accordance with 303. In transfer type shower compartments, thresholds 1/2 inch (13 mm) high maximum shall be beveled, rounded, or vertical.

title: General
body: Grab bars in toilet facilities and bathing facilities shall comply with 609.

title: Cross Section
body: Grab bars shall have a cross section complying with 609.2.1 or 609.2.2.

title: Circular Cross Section
body: Grab bars with circular cross sections shall have an outside diameter of 1 1/4 inches (32 mm) minimum and 2 inches (51 mm) maximum.

title: Non-Circular Cross Section
body: Grab bars with non-circular cross sections shall have a cross-section dimension of 2 inches (51 mm) maximum and a perimeter dimension of 4 inches (100 mm) minimum and 4.8 inches (120 mm) maximum.

title: Spacing
body: The space between the wall and the grab bar shall be 1 1/2 inches (38 mm). The space between the grab bar and projecting objects below and at the ends shall be 1 1/2 inches (38 mm) minimum. The space between the grab bar and projecting objects above shall be 12 inches (305 mm) minimum.

title: Position of Grab Bars
body: Grab bars shall be installed in a horizontal position, 33 inches (840 mm) minimum and 36 inches (915 mm) maximum above the finish floor measured to the top of the gripping surface, except that at water closets for children’s use complying with 604.9, grab bars shall be installed in a horizontal position 18 inches (455 mm) minimum and 27 inches (685 mm) maximum above the finish floor measured to the top of the gripping surface. The height of the lower grab bar on the back wall of a bathtub shall comply with 607.4.1.1 or 607.4.2.1.

title: Surface Hazards
body: Grab bars and any wall or other surfaces adjacent to grab bars shall be free of sharp or abrasive elements and shall have rounded edges.

title: Fittings
body: Grab bars shall not rotate within their fittings.

title: Installation
body: Grab bars shall be installed in any manner that provides a gripping surface at the specified locations and that does not obstruct the required clear floor space.

title: Structural Strength
body: Allowable stresses shall not be exceeded for materials used when a vertical or horizontal force of 250 pounds (1112 N) is applied at any point on the grab bar, fastener, mounting device, or supporting structure.

title: General
body: Seats in bathtubs and shower compartments shall comply with 610.

title: Bathtub Seats
body: The top of bathtub seats shall be 17 inches (430 mm) minimum and 19 inches (485 mm) maximum above the bathroom finish floor. The depth of a removable in-tub seat shall be 15 inches (380 mm) minimum and 16 inches (405 mm) maximum. The seat shall be capable of secure placement. Permanent seats at the head end of the bathtub shall be 15 inches (380 mm) deep minimum and shall extend from the back wall to or beyond the outer edge of the bathtub.

title: Shower Compartment Seats
body: Where a seat is provided in a standard roll-in shower compartment, it shall be a folding type, shall be installed on the side wall adjacent to the controls, and shall extend from the back wall to a point within 3 inches (75 mm) of the compartment entry. Where a seat is provided in an alternate roll-in type shower compartment, it shall be a folding type, shall be installed on the front wall opposite the back wall, and shall extend from the adjacent side wall to a point within 3 inches (75 mm) of the compartment entry. In transfer-type showers, the seat shall extend from the back wall to a point within 3 inches (75 mm) of the compartment entry. The top of the seat shall be 17 inches (430 mm) minimum and 19 inches (485 mm) maximum above the bathroom finish floor. Seats shall comply with 610.3.1 or 610.3.2.

title: Rectangular Seats
body: The rear edge of a rectangular seat shall be 2 1/2 inches (64 mm) maximum and the front edge 15 inches (380 mm) minimum and 16 inches (405 mm) maximum from the seat wall. The side edge of the seat shall be 1 1/2 inches (38 mm) maximum from the adjacent wall.

title: L-Shaped Seats
body: The rear edge of an L-shaped seat shall be 2 1/2 inches (64 mm) maximum and the front edge 15 inches (380 mm) minimum and 16 inches (405 mm) maximum from the seat wall. The rear edge of the “L” portion of the seat shall be 1 1/2 inches (38 mm) maximum from the wall and the front edge shall be 14 inches (355 mm) minimum and 15 inches (380 mm) maximum from the wall. The end of the “L” shall be 22 inches (560 mm) minimum and 23 inches maximum (585 mm) from the main seat wall.

title: Structural Strength
body: Allowable stresses shall not be exceeded for materials used when a vertical or horizontal force of 250 pounds (1112 N) is applied at any point on the seat, fastener, mounting device, or supporting structure.

title: General
body: Washing machines and clothes dryers shall comply with 611.

title: Clear Floor Space
body: A clear floor or ground space complying with 305 positioned for parallel approach shall be provided. The clear floor or ground space shall be centered on the appliance.

title: Operable Parts
body: Operable parts, including doors, lint screens, and detergent and bleach compartments shall comply with 309.

title: Height
body: Top loading machines shall have the door to the laundry compartment located 36 inches (915 mm) maximum above the finish floor. Front loading machines shall have the bottom of the opening to the laundry compartment located 15 inches (380 mm) minimum and 36 inches (915 mm) maximum above the finish floor.

title: General
body: Saunas and steam rooms shall comply with 612.

title: Bench
body: Where seating is provided in saunas and steam rooms, at least one bench shall comply with 903. Doors shall not swing into the clear floor space required by 903.2.

title: Turning Space
body: A turning space complying with 304 shall be provided within saunas and steam rooms.

title: Scope
body: The provisions of Chapter 7 shall apply where required by Chapter 2 or where referenced by a requirement in this document.

title: General
body: Fire alarm systems shall have permanently installed audible and visible alarms complying with NFPA 72 (1999 or 2002 edition) (incorporated by reference, see “Referenced Standards” in Chapter 1), except that the maximum allowable sound level of audible notification appliances complying with section 4-3.2.1 of NFPA 72 (1999 edition) shall have a sound level no more than 110 dB at the minimum hearing distance from the audible appliance. In addition, alarms in guest rooms required to provide communication features shall comply with sections 4-3 and 4-4 of NFPA 72 (1999 edition) or sections 7.4 and 7.5 of NFPA 72 (2002 edition).

title: General
body: Signs shall comply with 703. Where both visual and tactile characters are required, either one sign with both visual and tactile characters, or two separate signs, one with visual, and one with tactile characters, shall be provided.

title: Raised Characters
body: Raised characters shall comply with 703.2 and shall be duplicated in braille complying with 703.3. Raised characters shall be installed in accordance with 703.4.

title: Depth
body: Raised characters shall be 1/32 inch (0.8 mm) minimum above their background.

title: Case
body: Characters shall be uppercase.

title: Style
body: Characters shall be sans serif. Characters shall not be italic, oblique, script, highly decorative, or of other unusual forms.

title: Character Proportions
body: Characters shall be selected from fonts where the width of the uppercase letter “O” is 55 percent minimum and 110 percent maximum of the height of the uppercase letter “I”.

title: Character Height
body: Character height measured vertically from the baseline of the character shall be 5/8 inch (16 mm) minimum and 2 inches (51 mm) maximum based on the height of the uppercase letter “I”.

title: Stroke Thickness
body: Stroke thickness of the uppercase letter “I” shall be 15 percent maximum of the height of the character.

title: Character Spacing
body: Character spacing shall be measured between the two closest points of adjacent raised characters within a message, excluding word spaces. Where characters have rectangular cross sections, spacing between individual raised characters shall be 1/8 inch (3.2 mm) minimum and 4 times the raised character stroke width maximum. Where characters have other cross sections, spacing between individual raised characters shall be 1/16 inch (1.6 mm) minimum and 4 times the raised character stroke width maximum at the base of the cross sections, and 1/8 inch (3.2 mm) minimum and 4 times the raised character stroke width maximum at the top of the cross sections. Characters shall be separated from raised borders and decorative elements 3/8 inch (9.5 mm) minimum.

title: Line Spacing
body: Spacing between the baselines of separate lines of raised characters within a message shall be 135 percent minimum and 170 percent maximum of the raised character height.

title: Braille
body: Braille shall be contracted (Grade 2) and shall comply with 703.3 and 703.4.

title: Dimensions and Capitalization
body: Braille dots shall have a domed or rounded shape and shall comply with Table 703.3.1. The indication of an uppercase letter or letters shall only be used before the first word of sentences, proper nouns and names, individual letters of the alphabet, initials, and acronyms.

title: Position
body: Braille shall be positioned below the corresponding text. If text is multi-lined, braille shall be placed below the entire text. Braille shall be separated 3/8 inch (9.5 mm) minimum from any other tactile characters and 3/8 inch (9.5 mm) minimum from raised borders and decorative elements.

title: Installation Height and Location
body: Signs with tactile characters shall comply with 703.4.

title: Height Above Finish Floor or Ground
body: Tactile characters on signs shall be located 48 inches (1220 mm) minimum above the finish floor or ground surface, measured from the baseline of the lowest tactile character and 60 inches (1525 mm) maximum above the finish floor or ground surface, measured from the baseline of the highest tactile character.

title: Location
body: Where a tactile sign is provided at a door, the sign shall be located alongside the door at the latch side. Where a tactile sign is provided at double doors with one active leaf, the sign shall be located on the inactive leaf. Where a tactile sign is provided at double doors with two active leafs, the sign shall be located to the right of the right hand door. Where there is no wall space at the latch side of a single door or at the right side of double doors, signs shall be located on the nearest adjacent wall. Signs containing tactile characters shall be located so that a clear floor space of 18 inches (455 mm) minimum by 18 inches (455 mm) minimum, centered on the tactile characters, is provided beyond the arc of any door swing between the closed position and 45 degree open position.

title: Visual Characters
body: Visual characters shall comply with 703.5.

title: Finish and Contrast
body: Characters and their background shall have a non-glare finish. Characters shall contrast with their background with either light characters on a dark background or dark characters on a light background.

title: Case
body: Characters shall be uppercase or lowercase or a combination of both.

title: Style
body: Characters shall be conventional in form. Characters shall not be italic, oblique, script, highly decorative, or of other unusual forms.

title: Character Proportions
body: Characters shall be selected from fonts where the width of the uppercase letter “O” is 55 percent minimum and 110 percent maximum of the height of the uppercase letter “I”.

title: Character Height
body: Minimum character height shall comply with Table 703.5.5. Viewing distance shall be measured as the horizontal distance between the character and an obstruction preventing further approach towards the sign. Character height shall be based on the uppercase letter “I”.

title: Height From Finish Floor or Ground
body: Visual characters shall be 40 inches (1015 mm) minimum above the finish floor or ground.

title: Stroke Thickness
body: Stroke thickness of the uppercase letter “I” shall be 10 percent minimum and 30 percent maximum of the height of the character.

title: Character Spacing
body: Character spacing shall be measured between the two closest points of adjacent characters, excluding word spaces. Spacing between individual characters shall be 10 percent minimum and 35 percent maximum of character height.

title: Line Spacing
body: Spacing between the baselines of separate lines of characters within a message shall be 135 percent minimum and 170 percent maximum of the character height.

title: Pictograms
body: Pictograms shall comply with 703.6.

title: Pictogram Field
body: Pictograms shall have a field height of 6 inches (150 mm) minimum. Characters and braille shall not be located in the pictogram field.

title: Finish and Contrast
body: Pictograms and their field shall have a non-glare finish. Pictograms shall contrast with their field with either a light pictogram on a dark field or a dark pictogram on a light field.

title: Text Descriptors
body: Pictograms shall have text descriptors located directly below the pictogram field. Text descriptors shall comply with 703.2, 703.3 and 703.4.

title: Symbols of Accessibility
body: Symbols of accessibility shall comply with 703.7.

title: Finish and Contrast
body: Symbols of accessibility and their background shall have a non-glare finish. Symbols of accessibility shall contrast with their background with either a light symbol on a dark background or a dark symbol on a light background.

title: International Symbol of Accessibility
body: The International Symbol of Accessibility shall comply with Figure 703.7.2.1.

title: International Symbol of TTY
body: The International Symbol of TTY shall comply with Figure 703.7.2.2.

title: Volume Control Telephones
body: Telephones with a volume control shall be identified by a pictogram of a telephone handset with radiating sound waves on a square field such as shown in Figure 703.7.2.3.

title: Assistive Listening Systems
body: Assistive listening systems shall be identified by the International Symbol of Access for Hearing Loss complying with Figure 703.7.2.4.

title: General
body: Public telephones shall comply with 704.

title: Wheelchair Accessible Telephones
body: Wheelchair accessible telephones shall comply with 704.2.

title: Clear Floor or Ground Space
body: A clear floor or ground space complying with 305 shall be provided. The clear floor or ground space shall not be obstructed by bases, enclosures, or seats.

title: Parallel Approach
body: Where a parallel approach is provided, the distance from the edge of the telephone enclosure to the face of the telephone unit shall be 10 inches (255 mm) maximum.

title: Forward Approach
body: Where a forward approach is provided, the distance from the front edge of a counter within the telephone enclosure to the face of the telephone unit shall be 20 inches (510 mm) maximum.

title: Operable Parts
body: Operable parts shall comply with 309. Telephones shall have push-button controls where such service is available.

title: Telephone Directories
body: Telephone directories, where provided, shall be located in accordance with 309.

title: Cord Length
body: The cord from the telephone to the handset shall be 29 inches (735 mm) long minimum.

title: Volume Control Telephones
body: Public telephones required to have volume controls shall be equipped with a receive volume control that provides a gain adjustable up to 20 dB minimum. For incremental volume control, provide at least one intermediate step of 12 dB of gain minimum. An automatic reset shall be provided.

title: TTYs
body: TTYs required at a public pay telephone shall be permanently affixed within, or adjacent to, the telephone enclosure. Where an acoustic coupler is used, the telephone cord shall be sufficiently long to allow connection of the TTY and the telephone receiver.

title: Height
body: When in use, the touch surface of TTY keypads shall be 34 inches (865 mm) minimum above the finish floor.

title: TTY Shelf
body: Public pay telephones required to accommodate portable TTYs shall be equipped with a shelf and an electrical outlet within or adjacent to the telephone enclosure. The telephone handset shall be capable of being placed flush on the surface of the shelf. The shelf shall be capable of accommodating a TTY and shall have 6 inches (150 mm) minimum vertical clearance above the area where the TTY is to be placed.

title: General
body: Detectable warnings shall consist of a surface of truncated domes and shall comply with 705.

title: Dome Size
body: Truncated domes in a detectable warning surface shall have a base diameter of 0.9 inch (23 mm) minimum and 1.4 inches (36 mm) maximum, a top diameter of 50 percent of the base diameter minimum to 65 percent of the base diameter maximum, and a height of 0.2 inch (5.1 mm).

title: Dome Spacing
body: Truncated domes in a detectable warning surface shall have a center-to-center spacing of 1.6 inches (41 mm) minimum and 2.4 inches (61 mm) maximum, and a base-to-base spacing of 0.65 inch (17 mm) minimum, measured between the most adjacent domes on a square grid.

title: Contrast
body: Detectable warning surfaces shall contrast visually with adjacent walking surfaces either light-on-dark, or dark-on-light.

title: Platform Edges
body: Detectable warning surfaces at platform boarding edges shall be 24 inches (610 mm) wide and shall extend the full length of the public use areas of the platform.

title: General
body: Assistive listening systems required in assembly areas shall comply with 706.

title: Receiver Jacks
body: Receivers required for use with an assistive listening system shall include a 1/8 inch (3.2 mm) standard mono jack.

title: Receiver Hearing-Aid Compatibility
body: Receivers required to be hearing-aid compatible shall interface with telecoils in hearing aids through the provision of neckloops.

title: Sound Pressure Level
body: Assistive listening systems shall be capable of providing a sound pressure level of 110 dB minimum and 118 dB maximum with a dynamic range on the volume control of 50 dB.

title: Signal-to-Noise Ratio
body: The signal-to-noise ratio for internally generated noise in assistive listening systems shall be 18 dB minimum.

title: Peak Clipping Level
body: Peak clipping shall not exceed 18 dB of clipping relative to the peaks of speech.

section: 707 Automatic Teller Machines and Fare Machines
title: General
body: Automatic teller machines and fare machines shall comply with 707.

section: 707 Automatic Teller Machines and Fare Machines
title: Clear Floor or Ground Space
body: A clear floor or ground space complying with 305 shall be provided.

section: 707 Automatic Teller Machines and Fare Machines
title: Operable Parts
body: Operable parts shall comply with 309. Unless a clear or correct key is provided, each operable part shall be able to be differentiated by sound or touch, without activation.

section: 707 Automatic Teller Machines and Fare Machines
title: Privacy
body: Automatic teller machines shall provide the opportunity for the same degree of privacy of input and output available to all individuals.

section: 707 Automatic Teller Machines and Fare Machines
title: Speech Output
body: Machines shall be speech enabled. Operating instructions and orientation, visible transaction prompts, user input verification, error messages, and all displayed information for full use shall be accessible to and independently usable by individuals with vision impairments. Speech shall be delivered through a mechanism that is readily available to all users, including but not limited to, an industry standard connector or a telephone handset. Speech shall be recorded or digitized human, or synthesized.

section: 707 Automatic Teller Machines and Fare Machines
title: User Control
body: Speech shall be capable of being repeated or interrupted. Volume control shall be provided for the speech function.

section: 707 Automatic Teller Machines and Fare Machines
title: Receipts
body: Where receipts are provided, speech output devices shall provide audible balance inquiry information, error messages, and all other information on the printed receipt necessary to complete or verify the transaction.

section: 707 Automatic Teller Machines and Fare Machines
title: Input
body: Input devices shall comply with 707.6.

section: 707 Automatic Teller Machines and Fare Machines
title: Input Controls
body: At least one tactilely discernible input control shall be provided for each function. Where provided, key surfaces not on active areas of display screens, shall be raised above surrounding surfaces. Where membrane keys are the only method of input, each shall be tactilely discernable from surrounding surfaces and adjacent keys.

section: 707 Automatic Teller Machines and Fare Machines
title: Numeric Keys
