body: Numeric keys shall be arranged in a 12-key ascending or descending telephone keypad layout. The number five key shall be tactilely distinct from the other keys.

section: 707 Automatic Teller Machines and Fare Machines
title: Function Keys
body: Function keys shall comply with 707.6.3.

section: 707 Automatic Teller Machines and Fare Machines
title: Contrast
body: Function keys shall contrast visually from background surfaces. Characters and symbols on key surfaces shall contrast visually from key surfaces. Visual contrast shall be either light-on-dark or dark-on-light.

section: 707 Automatic Teller Machines and Fare Machines
title: Tactile Symbols
body: Function key surfaces shall have tactile symbols as follows: Enter or Proceed key: raised circle; Clear or Correct key: raised left arrow; Cancel key: raised letter ex; Add Value key: raised plus sign; Decrease Value key: raised minus sign.

section: 707 Automatic Teller Machines and Fare Machines
title: Display Screen
body: The display screen shall comply with 707.7.

section: 707 Automatic Teller Machines and Fare Machines
title: Visibility
body: The display screen shall be visible from a point located 40 inches (1015 mm) above the center of the clear floor space in front of the machine.

section: 707 Automatic Teller Machines and Fare Machines
title: Characters
body: Characters displayed on the screen shall be in a sans serif font. Characters shall be 3/16 inch (4.8 mm) high minimum based on the uppercase letter “I”. Characters shall contrast with their background with either light characters on a dark background or dark characters on a light background.

section: 707 Automatic Teller Machines and Fare Machines
title: Braille Instructions
body: Braille instructions for initiating the speech mode shall be provided. Braille shall comply with 703.3.

title: General
body: Two-way communication systems shall comply with 708.

title: Audible and Visual Indicators
body: The system shall provide both audible and visual signals.

title: Handsets
body: Handset cords, if provided, shall be 29 inches (735 mm) long minimum.

title: Residential Dwelling Unit Communication Systems
body: Communications systems between a residential dwelling unit and a site, building, or floor entrance shall comply with 708.4.

title: Common Use or Public Use System Interface
body: The common use or public use system interface shall include the capability of supporting voice and TTY communication with the residential dwelling unit interface.

title: Residential Dwelling Unit Interface
body: The residential dwelling unit system interface shall include a telephone jack capable of supporting voice and TTY communication with the common use or public use system interface.

title: Scope
body: The provisions of Chapter 8 shall apply where required by Chapter 2 or where referenced by a requirement in this document.

section: 802 Wheelchair Spaces, Companion Seats, and Designated Aisle Seats
title: Wheelchair Spaces
body: Wheelchair spaces shall comply with 802.1.

section: 802 Wheelchair Spaces, Companion Seats, and Designated Aisle Seats
title: Floor or Ground Surface
body: The floor or ground surface of wheelchair spaces shall comply with 302. Changes in level are not permitted.

section: 802 Wheelchair Spaces, Companion Seats, and Designated Aisle Seats
title: Width
body: A single wheelchair space shall be 36 inches (915 mm) wide minimum Where two adjacent wheelchair spaces are provided, each wheelchair space shall be 33 inches (840 mm) wide minimum.

section: 802 Wheelchair Spaces, Companion Seats, and Designated Aisle Seats
title: Depth
body: Where a wheelchair space can be entered from the front or rear, the wheelchair space shall be 48 inches (1220 mm) deep minimum. Where a wheelchair space can be entered only from the side, the wheelchair space shall be 60 inches (1525 mm) deep minimum.

section: 802 Wheelchair Spaces, Companion Seats, and Designated Aisle Seats
title: Approach
body: Wheelchair spaces shall adjoin accessible routes. Accessible routes shall not overlap wheelchair spaces.

section: 802 Wheelchair Spaces, Companion Seats, and Designated Aisle Seats
title: Overlap
body: Wheelchair spaces shall not overlap circulation paths.

section: 802 Wheelchair Spaces, Companion Seats, and Designated Aisle Seats
title: Lines of Sight
body: Lines of sight to the screen, performance area, or playing field for spectators in wheelchair spaces shall comply with 802.2.

section: 802 Wheelchair Spaces, Companion Seats, and Designated Aisle Seats
title: Lines of Sight Over Seated Spectators
body: Where spectators are expected to remain seated during events, spectators in wheelchair spaces shall be afforded lines of sight complying with 802.2.1.

section: 802 Wheelchair Spaces, Companion Seats, and Designated Aisle Seats
title: Lines of Sight Over Heads
body: Where spectators are provided lines of sight over the heads of spectators seated in the first row in front of their seats, spectators seated in wheelchair spaces shall be afforded lines of sight over the heads of seated spectators in the first row in front of wheelchair spaces.

section: 802 Wheelchair Spaces, Companion Seats, and Designated Aisle Seats
title: Lines of Sight Between Heads
body: Where spectators are provided lines of sight over the shoulders and between the heads of spectators seated in the first row in front of their seats, spectators seated in wheelchair spaces shall be afforded lines of sight over the shoulders and between the heads of seated spectators in the first row in front of wheelchair spaces.

section: 802 Wheelchair Spaces, Companion Seats, and Designated Aisle Seats
title: Lines of Sight Over Standing Spectators
body: Where spectators are expected to stand during events, spectators in wheelchair spaces shall be afforded lines of sight complying with 802.2.2.

section: 802 Wheelchair Spaces, Companion Seats, and Designated Aisle Seats
title: Lines of Sight Over Heads
body: Where standing spectators are provided lines of sight over the heads of spectators standing in the first row in front of their seats, spectators seated in wheelchair spaces shall be afforded lines of sight over the heads of standing spectators in the first row in front of wheelchair spaces.

section: 802 Wheelchair Spaces, Companion Seats, and Designated Aisle Seats
title: Lines of Sight Between Heads
body: Where standing spectators are provided lines of sight over the shoulders and between the heads of spectators standing in the first row in front of their seats, spectators seated in wheelchair spaces shall be afforded lines of sight over the shoulders and between the heads of standing spectators in the first row in front of wheelchair spaces.

section: 802 Wheelchair Spaces, Companion Seats, and Designated Aisle Seats
title: Companion Seats
body: Companion seats shall comply with 802.3.

section: 802 Wheelchair Spaces, Companion Seats, and Designated Aisle Seats
title: Alignment
body: In row seating, companion seats shall be located to provide shoulder alignment with adjacent wheelchair spaces. The shoulder alignment point of the wheelchair space shall be measured 36 inches (915 mm) from the front of the wheelchair space. The floor surface of the companion seat shall be at the same elevation as the floor surface of the wheelchair space.

section: 802 Wheelchair Spaces, Companion Seats, and Designated Aisle Seats
title: Type
body: Companion seats shall be equivalent in size, quality, comfort, and amenities to the seating in the immediate area. Companion seats shall be permitted to be movable.

section: 802 Wheelchair Spaces, Companion Seats, and Designated Aisle Seats
title: Designated Aisle Seats
body: Designated aisle seats shall comply with 802.4.

section: 802 Wheelchair Spaces, Companion Seats, and Designated Aisle Seats
title: Armrests
body: Where armrests are provided on the seating in the immediate area, folding or retractable armrests shall be provided on the aisle side of the seat.

section: 802 Wheelchair Spaces, Companion Seats, and Designated Aisle Seats
title: Identification
body: Each designated aisle seat shall be identified by a sign or marker.

title: General
body: Dressing, fitting, and locker rooms shall comply with 803.

title: Turning Space
body: Turning space complying with 304 shall be provided within the room.

title: Door Swing
body: Doors shall not swing into the room unless a clear floor or ground space complying with 305.3 is provided beyond the arc of the door swing.

title: Benches
body: A bench complying with 903 shall be provided within the room.

title: Coat Hooks and Shelves
body: Coat hooks provided within the room shall be located within one of the reach ranges specified in 308. Shelves shall be 40 inches (1015 mm) minimum and 48 inches (1220 mm) maximum above the finish floor or ground.

title: General
body: Kitchens and kitchenettes shall comply with 804.

title: Clearance
body: Where a pass through kitchen is provided, clearances shall comply with 804.2.1. Where a U-shaped kitchen is provided, clearances shall comply with 804.2.2.

title: Pass Through Kitchen
body: In pass through kitchens where counters, appliances or cabinets are on two opposing sides, or where counters, appliances or cabinets are opposite a parallel wall, clearance between all opposing base cabinets, counter tops, appliances, or walls within kitchen work areas shall be 40 inches (1015 mm) minimum. Pass through kitchens shall have two entries.

title: U-Shaped
body: In U-shaped kitchens enclosed on three contiguous sides, clearance between all opposing base cabinets, counter tops, appliances, or walls within kitchen work areas shall be 60 inches (1525 mm) minimum.

title: Kitchen Work Surface
body: In residential dwelling units required to comply with 809, at least one 30 inches (760 mm) wide minimum section of counter shall provide a kitchen work surface that complies with 804.3.

title: Clear Floor or Ground Space
body: A clear floor space complying with 305 positioned for a forward approach shall be provided. The clear floor or ground space shall be centered on the kitchen work surface and shall provide knee and toe clearance complying with 306.

title: Height
body: The kitchen work surface shall be 34 inches (865 mm) maximum above the finish floor or ground.

title: Exposed Surfaces
body: There shall be no sharp or abrasive surfaces under the work surface counters.

title: Sinks
body: Sinks shall comply with 606.

title: Storage
body: At least 50 percent of shelf space in storage facilities shall comply with 811.

title: Appliances
body: Where provided, kitchen appliances shall comply with 804.6.

title: Clear Floor or Ground Space
body: A clear floor or ground space complying with 305 shall be provided at each kitchen appliance. Clear floor or ground spaces shall be permitted to overlap.

title: Operable Parts
body: All appliance controls shall comply with 309.

title: Dishwasher
body: Clear floor or ground space shall be positioned adjacent to the dishwasher door. The dishwasher door, in the open position, shall not obstruct the clear floor or ground space for the dishwasher or the sink.

title: Range or Cooktop
body: Where a forward approach is provided, the clear floor or ground space shall provide knee and toe clearance complying with 306. Where knee and toe space is provided, the underside of the range or cooktop shall be insulated or otherwise configured to prevent burns, abrasions, or electrical shock. The location of controls shall not require reaching across burners.

title: Oven
body: Ovens shall comply with 804.6.5.

title: Side-Hinged Door Ovens
body: Side-hinged door ovens shall have the work surface required by 804.3 positioned adjacent to the latch side of the oven door.

title: Bottom-Hinged Door Ovens
body: Bottom-hinged door ovens shall have the work surface required by 804.3 positioned adjacent to one side of the door.

title: Controls
body: Ovens shall have controls on front panels.

title: Refrigerator/Freezer
body: Combination refrigerators and freezers shall have at least 50 percent of the freezer space 54 inches (1370 mm) maximum above the finish floor or ground. The clear floor or ground space shall be positioned for a parallel approach to the space dedicated to a refrigerator/freezer with the centerline of the clear floor or ground space offset 24 inches (610 mm) maximum from the centerline of the dedicated space.

section: 805 Medical Care and Long-Term Care Facilities
title: General
body: Medical care facility and long-term care facility patient or resident sleeping rooms required to provide mobility features shall comply with 805.

section: 805 Medical Care and Long-Term Care Facilities
title: Turning Space
body: Turning space complying with 304 shall be provided within the room.

section: 805 Medical Care and Long-Term Care Facilities
title: Clear Floor or Ground Space
body: A clear floor space complying with 305 shall be provided on each side of the bed. The clear floor space shall be positioned for parallel approach to the side of the bed.

section: 805 Medical Care and Long-Term Care Facilities
title: Toilet and Bathing Rooms
body: Toilet and bathing rooms that are provided as part of a patient or resident sleeping room shall comply with 603. Where provided, no fewer than one water closet, one lavatory, and one bathtub or shower shall comply with the applicable requirements of 603 through 610.

title: General
body: Transient lodging guest rooms shall comply with 806. Guest rooms required to provide mobility features shall comply with 806.2. Guest rooms required to provide communication features shall comply with 806.3.

title: Guest Rooms with Mobility Features
body: Guest rooms required to provide mobility features shall comply with 806.2.

title: Living and Dining Areas
body: Living and dining areas shall be accessible.

title: Exterior Spaces
body: Exterior spaces, including patios, terraces and balconies, that serve the guest room shall be accessible.

title: Sleeping Areas
body: At least one sleeping area shall provide a clear floor space complying with 305 on both sides of a bed. The clear floor space shall be positioned for parallel approach to the side of the bed.

title: Toilet and Bathing Facilities
body: At least one bathroom that is provided as part of a guest room shall comply with 603. No fewer than one water closet, one lavatory, and one bathtub or shower shall comply with applicable requirements of 603 through 610. In addition, required roll-in shower compartments shall comply with 608.2.2 or 608.2.3. Toilet and bathing fixtures required to comply with 603 through 610 shall be permitted to be located in more than one toilet or bathing area, provided that travel between fixtures does not require travel between other parts of the guest room.

title: Vanity Counter Top Space
body: If vanity counter top space is provided in non-accessible guest toilet or bathing rooms, comparable vanity counter top space, in terms of size and proximity to the lavatory, shall also be provided in accessible guest toilet or bathing rooms.

title: Kitchens and Kitchenettes
body: Kitchens and kitchenettes shall comply with 804.

title: Turning Space
body: Turning space complying with 304 shall be provided within the guest room.

title: Guest Rooms with Communication Features
body: Guest rooms required to provide communication features shall comply with 806.3.

title: Alarms
body: Where emergency warning systems are provided, alarms complying with 702 shall be provided.

title: Notification Devices
body: Visible notification devices shall be provided to alert room occupants of incoming telephone calls and a door knock or bell. Notification devices shall not be connected to visible alarm signal appliances. Telephones shall have volume controls compatible with the telephone system and shall comply with 704.3. Telephones shall be served by an electrical outlet complying with 309 located within 48 inches (1220 mm) of the telephone to facilitate the use of a TTY.

title: General
body: Holding cells and housing cells shall comply with 807.

title: Cells with Mobility Features
body: Cells required to provide mobility features shall comply with 807.2.

title: Turning Space
body: Turning space complying with 304 shall be provided within the cell.

title: Benches
body: Where benches are provided, at least one bench shall comply with 903.

title: Beds
body: Where beds are provided, clear floor space complying with 305 shall be provided on at least one side of the bed. The clear floor space shall be positioned for parallel approach to the side of the bed.

title: Toilet and Bathing Facilities
body: Toilet facilities or bathing facilities that are provided as part of a cell shall comply with 603. Where provided, no fewer than one water closet, one lavatory, and one bathtub or shower shall comply with the applicable requirements of 603 through 610.

title: Cells with Communication Features
body: Cells required to provide communication features shall comply with 807.3.

title: Alarms
body: Where audible emergency alarm systems are provided to serve the occupants of cells, visible alarms complying with 702 shall be provided.

title: Telephones
body: Telephones, where provided within cells, shall have volume controls complying with 704.3.

title: General
body: Courtrooms shall comply with 808.

title: Turning Space
body: Where provided, areas that are raised or depressed and accessed by ramps or platform lifts with entry ramps shall provide unobstructed turning space complying with 304.

title: Clear Floor Space
body: Each jury box and witness stand shall have, within its defined area, clear floor space complying with 305.

title: Judges’ Benches and Courtroom Stations
body: Judges’ benches, clerks’ stations, bailiffs’ stations, deputy clerks’ stations, court reporters’ stations and litigants’ and counsel stations shall comply with 902.

title: General
body: Residential dwelling units shall comply with 809. Residential dwelling units required to provide mobility features shall comply with 809.2 through 809.4. Residential dwelling units required to provide communication features shall comply with 809.5.

title: Accessible Routes
body: Accessible routes complying with Chapter 4 shall be provided within residential dwelling units in accordance with 809.2.

title: Location
body: At least one accessible route shall connect all spaces and elements which are a part of the residential dwelling unit. Where only one accessible route is provided, it shall not pass through bathrooms, closets, or similar spaces.

title: Turning Space
body: All rooms served by an accessible route shall provide a turning space complying with 304.

title: Kitchen
body: Where a kitchen is provided, it shall comply with 804.

title: Toilet Facilities and Bathing Facilities
body: At least one bathroom shall comply with 603. No fewer than one of each type of fixture provided shall comply with applicable requirements of 603 through 610. Toilet and bathing fixtures required to comply with 603 through 610 shall be located in the same toilet and bathing area, such that travel between fixtures does not require travel between other parts of the residential dwelling unit.

title: Residential Dwelling Units with Communication Features
body: Residential dwelling units required to provide communication features shall comply with 809.5.

title: Building Fire Alarm System
body: Where a building fire alarm system is provided, the system wiring shall be extended to a point within the residential dwelling unit in the vicinity of the residential dwelling unit smoke detection system.

title: Alarm Appliances
body: Where alarm appliances are provided within a residential dwelling unit as part of the building fire alarm system, they shall comply with 702.

title: Activation
body: All visible alarm appliances provided within the residential dwelling unit for building fire alarm notification shall be activated upon activation of the building fire alarm in the portion of the building containing the residential dwelling unit.

title: Residential Dwelling Unit Smoke Detection System
body: Residential dwelling unit smoke detection systems shall comply with NFPA 72 (1999 or 2002 edition) (incorporated by reference, see “Referenced Standards” in Chapter 1).

title: Activation
body: All visible alarm appliances provided within the residential dwelling unit for smoke detection notification shall be activated upon smoke detection.

title: Interconnection
body: The same visible alarm appliances shall be permitted to provide notification of residential dwelling unit smoke detection and building fire alarm activation.

title: Prohibited Use
body: Visible alarm appliances used to indicate residential dwelling unit smoke detection or building fire alarm activation shall not be used for any other purpose within the residential dwelling unit.

title: Residential Dwelling Unit Primary Entrance
body: Communication features shall be provided at the residential dwelling unit primary entrance complying with 809.5.5.

title: Notification
body: A hard-wired electric doorbell shall be provided. A button or switch shall be provided outside the residential dwelling unit primary entrance. Activation of the button or switch shall initiate an audible tone and visible signal within the residential dwelling unit. Where visible doorbell signals are located in sleeping areas, they shall have controls to deactivate the signal.

title: Identification
body: A means for visually identifying a visitor without opening the residential dwelling unit entry door shall be provided and shall allow for a minimum 180 degree range of view.

title: Site, Building, or Floor Entrance
body: Where a system, including a closed-circuit system, permitting voice communication between a visitor and the occupant of the residential dwelling unit is provided, the system shall comply with 708.4.

title: General
body: Transportation facilities shall comply with 810.

title: Bus Boarding and Alighting Areas
body: Bus boarding and alighting areas shall comply with 810.2.

title: Surface
body: Bus stop boarding and alighting areas shall have a firm, stable surface.

title: Dimensions
body: Bus stop boarding and alighting areas shall provide a clear length of 96 inches (2440 mm) minimum, measured perpendicular to the curb or vehicle roadway edge, and a clear width of 60 inches (1525 mm) minimum, measured parallel to the vehicle roadway.

title: Connection
body: Bus stop boarding and alighting areas shall be connected to streets, sidewalks, or pedestrian paths by an accessible route complying with 402.

title: Slope
body: Parallel to the roadway, the slope of the bus stop boarding and alighting area shall be the same as the roadway, to the maximum extent practicable. Perpendicular to the roadway, the slope of the bus stop boarding and alighting area shall not be steeper than1:48.

title: Bus Shelters
body: Bus shelters shall provide a minimum clear floor or ground space complying with 305 entirely within the shelter. Bus shelters shall be connected by an accessible route complying with 402 to a boarding and alighting area complying with 810.2.

title: Bus Signs
body: Bus route identification signs shall comply with 703.5.1 through 703.5.4, and 703.5.7 and 703.5.8. In addition, to the maximum extent practicable, bus route identification signs shall comply with 703.5.5.

title: Rail Platforms
body: Rail platforms shall comply with 810.5.

title: Slope
body: Rail platforms shall not exceed a slope of 1:48 in all directions.

title: Detectable Warnings
body: Platform boarding edges not protected by platform screens or guards shall have detectable warnings complying with 705 along the full length of the public use area of the platform.

title: Platform and Vehicle Floor Coordination
body: Station platforms shall be positioned to coordinate with vehicles in accordance with the applicable requirements of 36 CFR Part 1192. Low-level platforms shall be 8 inches (205 mm) minimum above top of rail.

title: Rail Station Signs
body: Rail station signs shall comply with 810.6.

title: Entrances
body: Where signs identify a station or its entrance, at least one sign at each entrance shall comply with 703.2 and shall be placed in uniform locations to the maximum extent practicable. Where signs identify a station that has no defined entrance, at least one sign shall comply with 703.2 and shall be placed in a central location.

title: Routes and Destinations
body: Lists of stations, routes and destinations served by the station which are located on boarding areas, platforms, or mezzanines shall comply with 703.5. At least one tactile sign identifying the specific station and complying with 703.2 shall be provided on each platform or boarding area. Signs covered by this requirement shall, to the maximum extent practicable, be placed in uniform locations within the system.

title: Station Names
body: Stations covered by this section shall have identification signs complying with 703.5. Signs shall be clearly visible and within the sight lines of standing and sitting passengers from within the vehicle on both sides when not obstructed by another vehicle.

title: Public Address Systems
body: Where public address systems convey audible information to the public, the same or equivalent information shall be provided in a visual format.

title: Clocks
body: Where clocks are provided for use by the public, the clock face shall be uncluttered so that its elements are clearly visible. Hands, numerals and digits shall contrast with the background either light-on-dark or dark-on-light. Where clocks are installed overhead, numerals and digits shall comply with 703.5.

title: Escalators
body: Where provided, escalators shall comply with the sections 6.1.3.5.6 and 6.1.3.6.5 of ASME A17.1 (incorporated by reference, see “Referenced Standards” in Chapter 1) and shall have a clear width of 32 inches (815 mm) minimum.

title: Track Crossings
body: Where a circulation path serving boarding platforms crosses tracks, it shall comply with 402.

title: General
body: Storage shall comply with 811.

title: Clear Floor or Ground Space
body: A clear floor or ground space complying with 305 shall be provided.

title: Height
body: Storage elements shall comply with at least one of the reach ranges specified in 308.

title: Operable Parts
body: Operable parts shall comply with 309.

title: Scope
body: The provisions of Chapter 9 shall apply where required by Chapter 2 or where referenced by a requirement in this document.

title: General
body: Dining surfaces and work surfaces shall comply with 902.2 and 902.3.

title: Clear Floor or Ground Space
body: A clear floor space complying with 305 positioned for a forward approach shall be provided. Knee and toe clearance complying with 306 shall be provided.

title: Height
body: The tops of dining surfaces and work surfaces shall be 28 inches (710 mm) minimum and 34 inches (865 mm) maximum above the finish floor or ground.

title: Dining Surfaces and Work Surfaces for Children’s Use
body: Accessible dining surfaces and work surfaces for children’s use shall comply with 902.4.

title: Clear Floor or Ground Space
body: A clear floor space complying with 305 positioned for forward approach shall be provided. Knee and toe clearance complying with 306 shall be provided, except that knee clearance 24 inches (610 mm) minimum above the finish floor or ground shall be permitted.

title: Height
body: The tops of tables and counters shall be 26 inches (660 mm) minimum and 30 inches (760 mm) maximum above the finish floor or ground.

title: General
body: Benches shall comply with 903.

title: Clear Floor or Ground Space
body: Clear floor or ground space complying with 305 shall be provided and shall be positioned at the end of the bench seat and parallel to the short axis of the bench.

title: Size
body: Benches shall have seats that are 42 inches (1065 mm) long minimum and 20 inches (510 mm) deep minimum and 24 inches (610 mm) deep maximum.

title: Back Support
body: The bench shall provide for back support or shall be affixed to a wall. Back support shall be 42 inches (1065 mm) long minimum and shall extend from a point 2 inches (51 mm) maximum above the seat surface to a point 18 inches (455 mm) minimum above the seat surface. Back support shall be 2 1/2 inches (64 mm) maximum from the rear edge of the seat measured horizontally.

title: Height
body: The top of the bench seat surface shall be 17 inches (430 mm) minimum and 19 inches (485 mm) maximum above the finish floor or ground.

title: Structural Strength
body: Allowable stresses shall not be exceeded for materials used when a vertical or horizontal force of 250 pounds (1112 N) is applied at any point on the seat, fastener, mounting device, or supporting structure.

title: Wet Locations
body: Where installed in wet locations, the surface of the seat shall be slip resistant and shall not accumulate water.

section: 904 Check-Out Aisles and Sales and Service Counters
title: General
body: Check-out aisles and sales and service counters shall comply with the applicable requirements of 904.

section: 904 Check-Out Aisles and Sales and Service Counters
title: Approach
body: All portions of counters required to comply with 904 shall be located adjacent to a walking surface complying with 403.

section: 904 Check-Out Aisles and Sales and Service Counters
title: Check-Out Aisles
body: Check-out aisles shall comply with 904.3.

section: 904 Check-Out Aisles and Sales and Service Counters
title: Aisle
body: Aisles shall comply with 403.

section: 904 Check-Out Aisles and Sales and Service Counters
title: Counter
body: The counter surface height shall be 38 inches (965 mm) maximum above the finish floor or ground. The top of the counter edge protection shall be 2 inches (51 mm) maximum above the top of the counter surface on the aisle side of the check-out counter.

section: 904 Check-Out Aisles and Sales and Service Counters
title: Check Writing Surfaces
body: Where provided, check writing surfaces shall comply with 902.3.

section: 904 Check-Out Aisles and Sales and Service Counters
title: Sales and Service Counters
body: Sales counters and service counters shall comply with 904.4.1 or 904.4.2. The accessible portion of the counter top shall extend the same depth as the sales or service counter top.

section: 904 Check-Out Aisles and Sales and Service Counters
title: Parallel Approach
body: A portion of the counter surface that is 36 inches (915 mm) long minimum and 36 inches (915 mm) high maximum above the finish floor shall be provided. A clear floor or ground space complying with 305 shall be positioned for a parallel approach adjacent to the 36 inch (915 mm) minimum length of counter.

section: 904 Check-Out Aisles and Sales and Service Counters
title: Forward Approach
body: A portion of the counter surface that is 30 inches (760 mm) long minimum and 36 inches (915 mm) high maximum shall be provided. Knee and toe space complying with 306 shall be provided under the counter. A clear floor or ground space complying with 305 shall be positioned for a forward approach to the counter.

section: 904 Check-Out Aisles and Sales and Service Counters
title: Food Service Lines
body: Counters in food service lines shall comply with 904.5.

section: 904 Check-Out Aisles and Sales and Service Counters
title: Self-Service Shelves and Dispensing Devices
body: Self-service shelves and dispensing devices for tableware, dishware, condiments, food and beverages shall comply with 308.

section: 904 Check-Out Aisles and Sales and Service Counters
title: Tray Slides
body: The tops of tray slides shall be 28 inches (710 mm) minimum and 34 inches (865 mm) maximum above the finish floor or ground.

section: 904 Check-Out Aisles and Sales and Service Counters
title: Security Glazing
body: Where counters or teller windows have security glazing to separate personnel from the public, a method to facilitate voice communication shall be provided. Telephone handset devices, if provided, shall comply with 704.3.

title: Scope
body: The provisions of Chapter 10 shall apply where required by Chapter 2 or where referenced by a requirement in this document.

title: General
body: Amusement rides shall comply with 1002.

title: Accessible Routes
body: Accessible routes serving amusement rides shall comply with Chapter 4.

title: Load and Unload Areas
body: A turning space complying with 304.2 and 304.3 shall be provided in load and unload areas.

title: Wheelchair Spaces in Amusement Rides
body: Wheelchair spaces in amusement rides shall comply with 1002.4.

title: Floor or Ground Surface
body: The floor or ground surface of wheelchair spaces shall be stable and firm.

title: Slope
body: The floor or ground surface of wheelchair spaces shall have a slope not steeper than 1:48 when in the load and unload position.

title: Gaps
body: Floors of amusement rides with wheelchair spaces and floors of load and unload areas shall be coordinated so that, when amusement rides are at rest in the load and unload position, the vertical difference between the floors shall be within plus or minus 5/8 inches (16 mm) and the horizontal gap shall be 3 inches (75 mm) maximum under normal passenger load conditions.

title: Clearances
body: Clearances for wheelchair spaces shall comply with 1002.4.4.

title: Width and Length
body: Wheelchair spaces shall provide a clear width of 30 inches (760 mm) minimum and a clear length of 48 inches (1220 mm) minimum measured to 9 inches (230 mm) minimum above the floor surface.

title: Side Entry
body: Where wheelchair spaces are entered only from the side, amusement rides shall be designed to permit sufficient maneuvering clearance for individuals using a wheelchair or mobility aid to enter and exit the ride.

title: Permitted Protrusions in Wheelchair Spaces
body: Objects are permitted to protrude a distance of 6 inches (150 mm) maximum along the front of the wheelchair space, where located 9 inches (230 mm) minimum and 27 inches (685 mm) maximum above the floor or ground surface of the wheelchair space. Objects are permitted to protrude a distance of 25 inches (635 mm) maximum along the front of the wheelchair space, where located more than 27 inches (685 mm) above the floor or ground surface of the wheelchair space.

title: Ride Entry
body: Openings providing entry to wheelchair spaces on amusement rides shall be 32 inches (815 mm) minimum clear.

title: Approach
body: One side of the wheelchair space shall adjoin an accessible route when in the load and unload position.

title: Companion Seats
body: Where the interior width of the amusement ride is greater than 53 inches (1345 mm), seating is provided for more than one rider, and the wheelchair is not required to be centered within the amusement ride, a companion seat shall be provided for each wheelchair space.

title: Shoulder-to-Shoulder Seating
body: Where an amusement ride provides shoulder-to-shoulder seating, companion seats shall be shoulder-to-shoulder with the adjacent wheelchair space.

title: Amusement Ride Seats Designed for Transfer
body: Amusement ride seats designed for transfer shall comply with 1002.5 when positioned for loading and unloading.

title: Clear Floor or Ground Space
body: A clear floor or ground space complying with 305 shall be provided in the load and unload area adjacent to the amusement ride seats designed for transfer.

title: Transfer Height
body: The height of amusement ride seats designed for transfer shall be 14 inches (355 mm) minimum and 24 inches (610 mm) maximum measured from the surface of the load and unload area.

title: Transfer Entry
body: Where openings are provided for transfer to amusement ride seats, the openings shall provide clearance for transfer from a wheelchair or mobility aid to the amusement ride seat.

title: Wheelchair Storage Space
body: Wheelchair storage spaces complying with 305 shall be provided in or adjacent to unload areas for each required amusement ride seat designed for transfer and shall not overlap any required means of egress or accessible route.

title: Transfer Devices for Use with Amusement Rides
body: Transfer devices for use with amusement rides shall comply with 1002.6 when positioned for loading and unloading.

title: Clear Floor or Ground Space
body: A clear floor or ground space complying with 305 shall be provided in the load and unload area adjacent to the transfer device.

title: Transfer Height
body: The height of transfer device seats shall be 14 inches (355 mm) minimum and 24 inches (610 mm) maximum measured from the load and unload surface.

title: Wheelchair Storage Space
body: Wheelchair storage spaces complying with 305 shall be provided in or adjacent to unload areas for each required transfer device and shall not overlap any required means of egress or accessible route.

title: General
body: Recreational boating facilities shall comply with 1003.

title: Accessible Routes
body: Accessible routes serving recreational boating facilities, including gangways and floating piers, shall comply with Chapter 4 except as modified by the exceptions in 1003.2.

title: Boat Slips
body: Accessible routes serving boat slips shall be permitted to use the exceptions in 1003.2.1.

title: Boarding Piers at Boat Launch Ramps
body: Accessible routes serving boarding piers at boat launch ramps shall be permitted to use the exceptions in 1003.2.2.

title: Clearances
body: Clearances at boat slips and on boarding piers at boat launch ramps shall comply with 1003.3.

title: Boat Slip Clearance
body: Boat slips shall provide clear pier space 60 inches (1525 mm) wide minimum and at least as long as the boat slips. Each 10 feet (3050 mm) maximum of linear pier edge serving boat slips shall contain at least one continuous clear opening 60 inches (1525 mm) wide minimum.

title: Boarding Pier Clearances
body: Boarding piers at boat launch ramps shall provide clear pier space 60 inches (1525 mm) wide minimum and shall extend the full length of the boarding pier. Every 10 feet (3050 mm) maximum of linear pier edge shall contain at least one continuous clear opening 60 inches (1525 mm) wide minimum.

title: Clear Floor Space
body: Exercise machines and equipment shall have a clear floor space complying with 305 positioned for transfer or for use by an individual seated in a wheelchair. Clear floor or ground spaces required at exercise machines and equipment shall be permitted to overlap.

title: Accessible Routes
body: Accessible routes serving fishing piers and platforms, including gangways and floating piers, shall comply with Chapter 4.

title: Railings
body: Where provided, railings, guards, or handrails shall comply with 1005.2.

title: Height
body: At least 25 percent of the railings, guards, or handrails shall be 34 inches (865 mm) maximum above the ground or deck surface.

title: Dispersion
body: Railings, guards, or handrails required to comply with 1005.2.1 shall be dispersed throughout the fishing pier or platform.

title: Edge Protection
body: Where railings, guards, or handrails complying with 1005.2 are provided, edge protection complying with 1005.3.1 or 1005.3.2 shall be provided.

title: Curb or Barrier
body: Curbs or barriers shall extend 2 inches (51 mm) minimum above the surface of the fishing pier or platform.

title: Extended Ground or Deck Surface
body: The ground or deck surface shall extend 12 inches (305 mm) minimum beyond the inside face of the railing. Toe clearance shall be provided and shall be 30 inches (760 mm) wide minimum and 9 inches (230 mm) minimum above the ground or deck surface beyond the railing.

title: Clear Floor or Ground Space
body: At each location where there are railings, guards, or handrails complying with 1005.2.1, a clear floor or ground space complying with 305 shall be provided. Where there are no railings, guards, or handrails, at least one clear floor or ground space complying with 305 shall be provided on the fishing pier or platform.

title: Turning Space
body: At least one turning space complying with 304.3 shall be provided on fishing piers and platforms.

title: General
body: Golf facilities shall comply with 1006.

title: Accessible Routes
body: Accessible routes serving teeing grounds, practice teeing grounds, putting greens, practice putting greens, teeing stations at driving ranges, course weather shelters, golf car rental areas, bag drop areas, and course toilet rooms shall comply with Chapter 4 and shall be 48 inches (1220 mm) wide minimum. Where handrails are provided, accessible routes shall be 60 inches (1525 mm) wide minimum.

title: Golf Car Passages
body: Golf car passages shall comply with 1006.3.

title: Clear Width
body: The clear width of golf car passages shall be 48 inches (1220 mm) minimum.

title: Barriers
body: Where curbs or other constructed barriers prevent golf cars from entering a fairway, openings 60 inches (1525 mm) wide minimum shall be provided at intervals not to exceed 75 yards (69 m).

title: Weather Shelters
body: A clear floor or ground space 60 inches (1525 mm) minimum by 96 inches (2440 mm) minimum shall be provided within weather shelters.

title: General
body: Miniature golf facilities shall comply with 1007.

title: Accessible Routes
body: Accessible routes serving holes on miniature golf courses shall comply with Chapter 4. Accessible routes located on playing surfaces of miniature golf holes shall be permitted to use the exceptions in 1007.2.

title: Start of Play
body: A clear floor or ground space 48 inches (1220 mm) minimum by 60 inches (1525 mm) minimum with slopes not steeper than 1:48 shall be provided at the start of play.

title: Golf Club Reach Range Area
body: All areas within holes where golf balls rest shall be within 36 inches (915 mm) maximum of a clear floor or ground space 36 inches (915 mm) wide minimum and 48 inches (1220 mm) long minimum having a running slope not steeper than 1:20. The clear floor or ground space shall be served by an accessible route.

title: General
body: Play areas shall comply with 1008.

title: Accessible Routes
body: Accessible routes serving play areas shall comply with Chapter 4 and 1008.2 and shall be permitted to use the exceptions in 1008.2.1 through 1008.2.3. Where accessible routes serve ground level play components, the vertical clearance shall be 80 inches high (2030 mm) minimum.

title: Ground Level and Elevated Play Components
body: Accessible routes serving ground level play components and elevated play components shall be permitted to use the exceptions in 1008.2.1.

title: Soft Contained Play Structures
body: Accessible routes serving soft contained play structures shall be permitted to use the exception in 1008.2.2.

title: Water Play Components
body: Accessible routes serving water play components shall be permitted to use the exceptions in 1008.2.3.

title: Clear Width
body: Accessible routes connecting play components shall provide a clear width complying with 1008.2.4.

title: Ground Level
body: At ground level, the clear width of accessible routes shall be 60 inches (1525 mm) minimum.

title: Elevated
body: The clear width of accessible routes connecting elevated play components shall be 36 inches (915 mm) minimum.

title: Ramps
body: Within play areas, ramps connecting ground level play components and ramps connecting elevated play components shall comply with 1008.2.5.

title: Ground Level
body: Ramp runs connecting ground level play components shall have a running slope not steeper than 1:16.

title: Elevated
body: The rise for any ramp run connecting elevated play components shall be 12 inches (305 mm) maximum.

title: Handrails
body: Where required on ramps serving play components, the handrails shall comply with 505 except as modified by 1008.2.5.3.

title: Handrail Gripping Surfaces
body: Handrail gripping surfaces with a circular cross section shall have an outside diameter of 0.95 inch (24 mm) minimum and 1.55 inches (39 mm) maximum. Where the shape of the gripping surface is non-circular, the handrail shall provide an equivalent gripping surface.

title: Handrail Height
body: The top of handrail gripping surfaces shall be 20 inches (510 mm) minimum and 28 inches (710 mm) maximum above the ramp surface.

title: Ground Surfaces
body: Ground surfaces on accessible routes, clear floor or ground spaces, and turning spaces shall comply with 1008.2.6.

title: Accessibility
body: Ground surfaces shall comply with ASTM F 1951 (incorporated by reference, see “Referenced Standards” in Chapter 1). Ground surfaces shall be inspected and maintained regularly and frequently to ensure continued compliance with ASTM F 1951.

title: Use Zones
body: Ground surfaces located within use zones shall comply with ASTM F 1292 (1999 edition or 2004 edition) (incorporated by reference, see “Referenced Standards” in Chapter 1).

title: Transfer Systems
body: Where transfer systems are provided to connect to elevated play components, transfer systems shall comply with 1008.3.

title: Transfer Platforms
body: Transfer platforms shall be provided where transfer is intended from wheelchairs or other mobility aids. Transfer platforms shall comply with 1008.3.1.

title: Size
body: Transfer platforms shall have level surfaces 14 inches (355 mm) deep minimum and 24 inches (610 mm) wide minimum.

title: Height
body: The height of transfer platforms shall be 11 inches (280 mm) minimum and 18 inches (455 mm) maximum measured to the top of the surface from the ground or floor surface.

title: Transfer Space
body: A transfer space complying with 305.2 and 305.3 shall be provided adjacent to the transfer platform. The 48 inch (1220 mm) long minimum dimension of the transfer space shall be centered on and parallel to the 24 inch (610 mm) long minimum side of the transfer platform. The side of the transfer platform serving the transfer space shall be unobstructed.

title: Transfer Supports
body: At least one means of support for transferring shall be provided.

title: Transfer Steps
body: Transfer steps shall be provided where movement is intended from transfer platforms to levels with elevated play components required to be on accessible routes. Transfer steps shall comply with 1008.3.2.

title: Size
body: Transfer steps shall have level surfaces 14 inches (355 mm) deep minimum and 24 inches (610 mm) wide minimum.

title: Height
body: Each transfer step shall be 8 inches (205 mm) high maximum.

title: Transfer Supports
body: At least one means of support for transferring shall be provided.

title: Play Components
body: Ground level play components on accessible routes and elevated play components connected by ramps shall comply with 1008.4.

title: Turning Space
body: At least one turning space complying with 304 shall be provided on the same level as play components. Where swings are provided, the turning space shall be located immediately adjacent to the swing.

title: Clear Floor or Ground Space
body: Clear floor or ground space complying with 305.2 and 305.3 shall be provided at play components.

title: Play Tables
body: Where play tables are provided, knee clearance 24 inches (610 mm) high minimum, 17 inches deep (430 mm) minimum, and 30 inches (760 mm) wide minimum shall be provided. The tops of rims, curbs, or other obstructions shall be 31 inches (785 mm) high maximum.

title: Entry Points and Seats
body: Where play components require transfer to entry points or seats, the entry points or seats shall be 11 inches (280 mm) minimum and 24 inches (610 mm) maximum from the clear floor or ground space.

title: Transfer Supports
body: Where play components require transfer to entry points or seats, at least one means of support for transferring shall be provided.

section: 1009 Swimming Pools, Wading Pools, and Spas
title: General
body: Where provided, pool lifts, sloped entries, transfer walls, transfer systems, and pool stairs shall comply with 1009.

section: 1009 Swimming Pools, Wading Pools, and Spas
title: Pool Lifts
body: Pool lifts shall comply with 1009.2.

section: 1009 Swimming Pools, Wading Pools, and Spas
title: Pool Lift Location
body: Pool lifts shall be located where the water level does not exceed 48 inches (1220 mm).

section: 1009 Swimming Pools, Wading Pools, and Spas
title: Seat Location
body: In the raised position, the centerline of the seat shall be located over the deck and 16 inches (405 mm) minimum from the edge of the pool. The deck surface between the centerline of the seat and the pool edge shall have a slope not steeper than 1:48.

section: 1009 Swimming Pools, Wading Pools, and Spas
title: Clear Deck Space
body: On the side of the seat opposite the water, a clear deck space shall be provided parallel with the seat. The space shall be 36 inches (915 mm) wide minimum and shall extend forward 48 inches (1220 mm) minimum from a line located 12 inches (305 mm) behind the rear edge of the seat. The clear deck space shall have a slope not steeper than 1:48.

section: 1009 Swimming Pools, Wading Pools, and Spas
title: Seat Height
body: The height of the lift seat shall be designed to allow a stop at 16 inches (405 mm) minimum to 19 inches (485 mm) maximum measured from the deck to the top of the seat surface when in the raised (load) position.

section: 1009 Swimming Pools, Wading Pools, and Spas
title: Seat Width
body: The seat shall be 16 inches (405 mm) wide minimum.

section: 1009 Swimming Pools, Wading Pools, and Spas
title: Footrests and Armrests
body: Footrests shall be provided and shall move with the seat. If provided, the armrest positioned opposite the water shall be removable or shall fold clear of the seat when the seat is in the raised (load) position.

section: 1009 Swimming Pools, Wading Pools, and Spas
title: Operation
body: The lift shall be capable of unassisted operation from both the deck and water levels. Controls and operating mechanisms shall be unobstructed when the lift is in use and shall comply with 309.4.

section: 1009 Swimming Pools, Wading Pools, and Spas
title: Submerged Depth
body: The lift shall be designed so that the seat will submerge to a water depth of 18 inches (455 mm) minimum below the stationary water level.

section: 1009 Swimming Pools, Wading Pools, and Spas
title: Lifting Capacity
body: Single person pool lifts shall have a weight capacity of 300 pounds. (136 kg) minimum and be capable of sustaining a static load of at least one and a half times the rated load.

section: 1009 Swimming Pools, Wading Pools, and Spas
title: Sloped Entries
body: Sloped entries shall comply with 1009.3.

section: 1009 Swimming Pools, Wading Pools, and Spas
title: Sloped Entries
body: Sloped entries shall comply with Chapter 4 except as modified in 1009.3.1 through 1009.3.3.

section: 1009 Swimming Pools, Wading Pools, and Spas
title: Submerged Depth
body: Sloped entries shall extend to a depth of 24 inches (610 mm) minimum and 30 inches (760 mm) maximum below the stationary water level. Where landings are required by 405.7, at least one landing shall be located 24 inches (610 mm) minimum and 30 inches (760 mm) maximum below the stationary water level.

section: 1009 Swimming Pools, Wading Pools, and Spas
title: Handrails
body: At least two handrails complying with 505 shall be provided on the sloped entry. The clear width between required handrails shall be 33 inches (840 mm) minimum and 38 inches (965 mm) maximum.

section: 1009 Swimming Pools, Wading Pools, and Spas
title: Transfer Walls
body: Transfer walls shall comply with 1009.4.

section: 1009 Swimming Pools, Wading Pools, and Spas
title: Clear Deck Space
body: A clear deck space of 60 inches (1525 mm) minimum by 60 inches (1525 mm) minimum with a slope not steeper than 1:48 shall be provided at the base of the transfer wall. Where one grab bar is provided, the clear deck space shall be centered on the grab bar. Where two grab bars are provided, the clear deck space shall be centered on the clearance between the grab bars.

section: 1009 Swimming Pools, Wading Pools, and Spas
title: Height
body: The height of the transfer wall shall be 16 inches (405 mm) minimum and 19 inches (485 mm) maximum measured from the deck.

section: 1009 Swimming Pools, Wading Pools, and Spas
title: Wall Depth and Length
body: The depth of the transfer wall shall be 12 inches (305 mm) minimum and 16 inches (405 mm) maximum. The length of the transfer wall shall be 60 inches (1525 mm) minimum and shall be centered on the clear deck space.

section: 1009 Swimming Pools, Wading Pools, and Spas
title: Surface
body: Surfaces of transfer walls shall not be sharp and shall have rounded edges.

section: 1009 Swimming Pools, Wading Pools, and Spas
title: Grab Bars
body: At least one grab bar complying with 609 shall be provided on the transfer wall. Grab bars shall be perpendicular to the pool wall and shall extend the full depth of the transfer wall. The top of the gripping surface shall be 4 inches (100 mm) minimum and 6 inches (150 mm) maximum above transfer walls. Where one grab bar is provided, clearance shall be 24 inches (610 mm) minimum on both sides of the grab bar. Where two grab bars are provided, clearance between grab bars shall be 24 inches (610 mm) minimum.

section: 1009 Swimming Pools, Wading Pools, and Spas
title: Transfer Systems
body: Transfer systems shall comply with 1009.5.

section: 1009 Swimming Pools, Wading Pools, and Spas
title: Transfer Platform
body: A transfer platform shall be provided at the head of each transfer system. Transfer platforms shall provide 19 inches (485 mm) minimum clear depth and 24 inches (610 mm) minimum clear width.

section: 1009 Swimming Pools, Wading Pools, and Spas
title: Transfer Space
body: A transfer space of 60 inches (1525 mm) minimum by 60 inches (1525 mm) minimum with a slope not steeper than 1:48 shall be provided at the base of the transfer platform surface and shall be centered along a 24 inch (610 mm) minimum side of the transfer platform. The side of the transfer platform serving the transfer space shall be unobstructed.

section: 1009 Swimming Pools, Wading Pools, and Spas
title: Height
body: The height of the transfer platform shall comply with 1009.4.2.

section: 1009 Swimming Pools, Wading Pools, and Spas
title: Transfer Steps
body: Transfer step height shall be 8 inches (205 mm) maximum. The surface of the bottom tread shall extend to a water depth of 18 inches (455 mm) minimum below the stationary water level.

section: 1009 Swimming Pools, Wading Pools, and Spas
title: Surface
body: The surface of the transfer system shall not be sharp and shall have rounded edges.

section: 1009 Swimming Pools, Wading Pools, and Spas
title: Size
body: Each transfer step shall have a tread clear depth of 14 inches (355 mm) minimum and 17 inches (430 mm) maximum and shall have a tread clear width of 24 inches (610 mm) minimum.

section: 1009 Swimming Pools, Wading Pools, and Spas
title: Grab Bars
body: At least one grab bar on each transfer step and the transfer platform or a continuous grab bar serving each transfer step and the transfer platform shall be provided. Where a grab bar is provided on each step, the tops of gripping surfaces shall be 4 inches (100 mm) minimum and 6 inches (150 mm) maximum above each step and transfer platform. Where a continuous grab bar is provided, the top of the gripping surface shall be 4 inches (100 mm) minimum and 6 inches (150 mm) maximum above the step nosing and transfer platform. Grab bars shall comply with 609 and be located on at least one side of the transfer system. The grab bar located at the transfer platform shall not obstruct transfer.

section: 1009 Swimming Pools, Wading Pools, and Spas
title: Pool Stairs
body: Pool stairs shall comply with 1009.6.

section: 1009 Swimming Pools, Wading Pools, and Spas
title: Pool Stairs
body: Pool stairs shall comply with 504.

section: 1009 Swimming Pools, Wading Pools, and Spas
title: Handrails
body: The width between handrails shall be 20 inches (510 mm) minimum and 24 inches (610 mm) maximum. Handrail extensions required by 505.10.3 shall not be required on pool stairs.

title: Turning Space
body: A circular turning space 60 inches (1525 mm) diameter minimum with slopes not steeper than 1:48 shall be provided at shooting facilities with firing positions.
